loans.name: Idris Kusa

texts.en: Idris Kusa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Idris Kusa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lami, Dear and Roda.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris Kusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris Kusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Idris Kusa  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: pay expenses until he can sell his crops

loans.name: Danfillo

texts.en: Danfillo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Danfillo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Gidion, Kalib and Dimas.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danfillo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danfillo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Danfillo  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: pay expenses until he can sell his crops

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Hassan, Saminu and Iliya.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hannatu  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: pay expenses until she can sell her crops

loans.name: Chidiogo

texts.en:
Chidiogo is 27 years old born in a family of 3. Her parents are very poor farmers although they have a good number of palm trees plantations, and are of age now. She is the last child who is assigned the responsibility of managing the family palm trees plantation. Since after her secondary education, Chidiogo could not proceed to the university because of the economic state of her family. to make ends meet, she joined other women in the village who are into palm oil processing. She decided to deal specifically on harvesting their palm bunches, and also buying palm bunches from other rural plantation owners and resale to her colleagues at the mill. 

At the moment she has a lot of clients in different mills and she is requesting this loan to enable her purchase more bunches within this season. A portion of the loan will also go to maintaining her family palm plantation. Early this year, she enroll to an Information Communication Technology school to enable her acquire a skill in a field she loves and admires much. She hopes that profits from this loan usage will help in offsetting her school fees and daily expenses, and also support her parents.

She thanks all Kiva lenders for supporting her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm bunches for this season

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 37-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a bar and lodge since 2011 to increase his income. Peter hopes to grow his business despite the challenges of load shedding and a lot of competition hindering his business. Peter is requesting a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is an Egyptian Albanian and so is Ayzon, her husband, who is been photographed with her; in the background you see some old stuff that they have collected. They will sell them because they make a living by collecting scrap metal, plastic, and glass; then they sell it in some manufacturers in their region.  They also buy sunflower seeds, and sell them, salted, in the streets and in the schools; kids buy a lot of them. 

Anila is 44, and a mother of a 19-year-old and a 24-year-old daughter who is married. 

Their neighbours commented to the loan officer about them being a very loving and peaceful couple who is seen all the time working; no one can miss their smiles all day.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell to manufacturers

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Angélica, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y su hijo.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 10 años en un pequeño carro de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica e inicio su negocio impulsada por la necesidad económica que atravesaba su familia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo comprar insumos para sus preparaciones y mejorar su capital de trabajo.

Su principal dificultad es la inseguridad que se presenta en el sector donde trabaja y la competencia de la zona.

Mejora la vida de esta colombiana con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Angélica is a woman of character and good will who has a desire to make progress and move forward with her husband and child. She decided to start her business making and selling fast food and drinks about ten years ago with a small food cart, with plenty of enthusiasm and initiative. She learned about this profession empirically and started her business due to her family's financial need. 

She would now like to give her business a small boost, which is why she needs a loan to buy supplies for her preparations and to improve her working capital. Her main difficulty is insecurity in the area where she works and competition in the area. The life of this Colombian woman will improve with a loan!

loans.use: to buy supplies for her preparations and improve her working capital.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot makes wooden baby cradles for a living; he’s got talents for it, and he says he loves it. In the northern region where he lives, almost every rural family raises the children on such things; thus the demand is high. 

Kastriot also has pigs and sows and chickens and plants and sells seasonal veggies and livestock products. His wife works in a shoe factory that is located nearby their village and is owned by foreign investors; their pay is $220/month each. 

Kastriot is seeking your help to finish building the house that they started building some time ago. Due to the fact that they did not have money, the house is unfinished. The couple, together with their four children, ranging in age from 13 to 19, and their elderly mother are expecting to live in it. 

Currently they live at some cousin’s house.

loans.use: to finish off the family house

loans.name: Zeferina

texts.en:
Zeferina is 56 years old and describes herself as mature, but with the need and desire to keep working.  She started her clothing business five years ago, and has been able to maintain it and grow it slowly.  

She is asking for a loan, because this is the high sales season, and she wants to have her business stocked to provide many options to her clients.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's clothes to sell for the end of year season.

loans.name: Daily Bread Group

texts.en:
Daily Bread is a group of four energetic women based in Dzivarasekwa in Harare. Tabbita is a member of Daily Bread group who is a cross border trader and she sells cosmetics, kitchenware and clothing restocking from South Africa. She also restocks from local wholesalers. 

Tabbita started her business in 2013 as a way to earn a living and support her family. Tabbita is a mother of 3 children, 2 of them go to school. Her business is helping her supplement her husband’s income as he is not formally employed and a casual worker. 

As a group they got training at Thrive Microfinance on how to run their small businesses. They learnt about record keeping, business assessment and the importance of savings. With her Kiva loan she looks forward to increasing her stock levels, hence increasing her income levels. She is looking forward to building a house for her family with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, kitchenware and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
This is Pamela who has 5 siblings. She has managed to complete a certificate course in Sales and Marketing that was paid by her father. She is currently pursing a diploma course in Business Management, but her father is not able to raise the funds to pay her school fees as he supports the other younger children.

She has great faith that after graduation she will be able to assist her father to raise fees for the rest of her siblings. This Kiva loan will assist her clear her pending tuition fees and enable her to graduate.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Beatrice Group

texts.en:
These women are the Beatrice Group which is made up of three women living in Mufakose Suburb. These entrepreneurs are hardworking, responsible people with a reputable behavior and lots of enthusiasm to improve their businesses and living standards.

The group's representative, Beatrice, is 35 years old. She is married with three children, and her husband is a teacher at a local school. Beatrice lives with her family, taking care of her children and helps her husband paying family expenses. For this reason, she has been buying and selling clothes for both men and women. She has been doing this business for the past three years getting her supplies from South Africa and Tanzania.

With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families' standards of living. They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble and guarantee each other for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tererai Group

texts.en:
Married with six children, three of them school, Juliana is a committed mother. She has been supporting her family with her tailoring business for the past 10 years. Juliana specialises in tailoring children’s clothes and tracksuits. Juliana is a member of Tererai group, a member of four dedicated and goal-oriented women. 

Juliana and her group members are currently in their 2nd loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. Juliana used to work from home before she came to Thrive. After getting her 1st loan from Thrive Microfinance she bought more materials for her business and her business grew. She is now operating at a local shopping centre, a busy centre where she is renting a space for her business. Juliana’s sales grew and she managed to procure a heavy duty fleece sewing machine. This has made work faster and easier for her as it enables her to sew many fleece tracksuits at a faster rate. 

With the current loan that has been advanced to her, Juliana plans to buy another sewing machine and an over locking machine. These two machines will increase production for Juliana and she also plans to employ someone so as to further grow her tailoring business and produce bulk products for wholesaling.

loans.use: To purchase an over-locking sewing machine and take on an employee.

loans.name: Myles

texts.en: This is Myles, a university student. He is unemployed with no source of income and lives in a rented house together with his 2 siblings and guardians. He is in his final year studying for a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. He dreams to be employed in the corporate world in the industrial sector working with a team of equal or more qualified engineers from all fields working together to improve the quality of life for their countrymen. He also desires one day to own his own Engineering firm. He is currently having  financial challenges and a Kiva loan will enable him to raise tuition fees to clear his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs for his Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 62 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion 's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Concepcion is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Concepcion has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. 

Concepcion is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Mae

texts.en:
Mary Mae is 23 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Mary Mae has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 33 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc..

Annalou has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years, and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Annalou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to make dried fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en:
Jenette is 35 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school; Jenette works very hard to provide for them.

Jenette runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, etc..

Jenette has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Norain

texts.en:
Norain is 44 years old, and married with three children, two of whom in school. Norain works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Norain has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 41 years old, with five children. With three children in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Marichu has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 42 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a business selling eggs in the Philippines. Percie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more eggs to sell.

Percie has been in this business for nine years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Prosper's Group

texts.en:
Prosper is 51 years old and a father of 5 children. Presently he pastors a church in Okpuno village. Annually Prosper and his wife get involved along with members of his church in palm oil processing. He also has a palm kernel cracking site. As an old member of Nke-Anyi farmer’s multipurpose cooperative society, he has enjoyed a loan product in the past and successfully paid it back. This time around, Prosper will like to take out this loan to purchase a new palm kernel cracking machine, separator and a generator to enable him increase production at his palm kernel cracking site.

He is one of the highest employers of labour in his village and to him, seeing this lowly youths earn their daily bread from his little investment makes him happy. Prosper and his group members appreciate all Kiva lenders in this regards.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil milling equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Potato Group

texts.en:
Rudo is a widowed mother of 2 school-going children who resides in Mufakose in Harare. Rudo and her two friends are members of Potato group. They formed this group with the aim of joining Thrive Microfinance so as to access business loans and receive business training and advice. Rudo has a road side stall where he sells clothing, vegetables and different groceries. 

Rudo plans to grow her business with her Kiva loan. She has dreams of expanding her business and opening shops so enabling her to provide for and educate her children. Rudo and her group members are go-getters who have future plans of having savings and helping each other to build homes and grow their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her tuckshop.

loans.name: Malone Group

texts.en:
Malone group is a group of four ladies doing small businesses in Crowborough North, Harare. They have come up together forming the group with the main purpose of accessing loans, receiving training and helping each other grow their businesses.  

Laiza is one of the members doing cross boarder trading, selling mainly children’s wear, foot wear and curtains. She  restocks from South Africa and Botswana. She is a married mother of two children going to school. 

Laiza started her business in 2011 just as a small stall at home which has now grown into a flea market table she is running at a local business centre. She makes a profit of $400 on average monthly after meeting her costs of restocking and transport. With the help of a loan of $350, Laiza will be able to boost her business with a vision to have a boutique in Harare Central Business District specializing in children’s wear.

loans.use: To expand her business selling shoes, clothes and curtains.

loans.name: Maria Haidy

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Puerto Triunfo desde donde se gana la vida con la venta de productos de uso personal como cremas a través de catálogos, adicionalmente se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina con preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos y productos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector donde vive.

Maria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, también desea aumentar su inventario de productos para vender; por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas y compra de surtido de mercancía para vender.

Trabaja todos los días durante aproximadamente 8 horas, el resto de tiempo lo dedica al cuidado de su familia.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante sus negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.

Con tu aporte Maria Podrá progresar en su negocio!
texts.en:
María's a modest and hardworking woman who has devoted a big part of her life to taking care of her children.

She lives in the town of Puerto Triunfo, where she earns a living making catalogue sales of personal care products such as lotions.  She also acquits herself spectacularly in the kitchen taking orders for food, including tamales, chorizo, and empanadas.  She sells these dishes and products mainly to neighbors in the area where she lives.  She works every day for approximately eight hours and devotes the rest of her time to taking care of her family.

María wants to increase her food sales and work more comfortably.  She also wants to expand her inventory of products to sell.  That's why she's requesting a loan to buy some kitchen utensils, ingredients to keep making her recipes, and a supply of merchandise to sell.  This loan will allow her to get ahead with her business so she earns the income she needs to keep on supporting her family.

María will be able to make progress in her business with your help!

loans.use: to buy ingredients to keep on making her recipes

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
Maria Carmen invested in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce the operating costs on her farm. Prior to this acquisition, she used to spend one hour every day walking in the surrounding mountains to look for wood, in addition to buying expensive LP gas. These sources of energy to cook and heat water in her house were not only damaging the environment, but the inhalation of the smoke produced by the wood while cooking was also harmful for Maria Carmen and her family's health. 

From now on, Maria Carmen will produce her own biogas and biofertilizer from her hogs', goats' and sheep's manure. She will displace the fossil fuel LP gas and chemical fertilizer she used to buy, generating monetary and time savings. The yield of her corn field will increase in a natural way through the nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer produced by the bacteria in the biodigester. 

By becoming self-sufficient with her energy and fertilizer supply, Maria Carmen will generate savings she plans to use to buy more hogs and to pay for her children's education.

This loans represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a six-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salve works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Salve is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Salve has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school. Rodelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a farming vegetables in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new seeds and other farming supplies.

Rodelyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future Rodelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and other farming supplies

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 58 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Virgilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, cigarettes, etc..

Virgilia has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, beverages, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson works hard to support her family. Samson is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of bananas to resell.

Samson has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to resell.

loans.name: Hernanita

texts.en:
Hernanita is 52 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Hernanita works very hard to provide for them.

Hernanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

Hernanita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Hernanita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret comes from Embu County, Kenya, where she is involved in horticulture farming, predominantly french beans. With more than 5 years experience, she is now capable of cultivating a bigger land profitably. The farming has helped her to educate her 5 children, 1 of whom is at university. 

With the increased acreage of farming, Margaret will increase her profits and improve living standards for her family.

loans.use: to rent more land and buy inputs for her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm inputs, hire labor and increase his potatoes farming output

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel tiene 40 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 20 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Israel is 40 years old. He is an entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead. He never quits, no matter what obstacles life throws at him. Instead he reaches all his goals and dreams. He has three children to support, the oldest of whom now works to help with the family's finances. The youngest two are excellent students at the local school. 

He makes a living growing bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him how to do this 20 years ago. He sells his products at the market and in the areas surrounding his community, and this provides him with an income to improve his family's living conditions. 

He will use the money from this loan to maintain his banana crops, since it is very important to him that his plants produce high quality fruit so that he does not lose the customers that he relies on. 

One of his greatest dreams is to plant more banana plants and to see his children finish their education and have professional careers.

loans.use: to maintain his banana crops.

loans.name: Ma. Dalisay

texts.en:
Ma. Dalisay is 52 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Dalisay works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

Ma. Dalisay has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Dalisay aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like, beverages, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase new seeds and fertilizer for her business.

Sarah has been in business for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire more farm inputs, labor and land to increase her potato production

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old, she is married with 2 kids. She used to live in Jos Plateau, in the North of Nigeria, a part of the country that has experienced intense attack from warring militants over the past years. Rebecca’s bad experience in the hands of these militants forced her to leave her job and flee to the South-East of the country. Presently she is a petty trader, dealing on palm oil retailing at a local market. 

She joined Nke-Anyi cooperative after been recommended by a member early 2014 and since then she has been a very active member of the cooperative. She purchases all her palm oil from the cooperative. Her new business gives her more rest of mind although not yielding much now because of limited capital.

A portion of this loan will enable Rebecca to buy more products for resale during the coming peak season. Profit from this will go a long way to help her support her husband to pay for a new accommodation because their present accommodation sanitary system is too poor with much health dangers. 

Rebecca thanks all lenders that share her predicament by supporting her loan

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros is an 18-year-old daughter from a farmer family and she is also a student at an institute in a province. For her study, she has been taking a banking and finance major. She lives with her parents and an old grandma in a village in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. 

Because she is short of financial support to pay her tuition fees, Sros has decided to secure a loan. This loan will help her to successfully graduate and provide her with a skill for her future job. 

Her dream is to find a proper job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Love's Group

texts.en:
Love is 36 years old and a mother of 3. She is a teacher at the community primary school. She lives with her husband and children in their family compound. To be able to meet up with her daily needs and that of her family, she joined the palm oil milling association. She invests part of her monthly salary into the trade, working every weekend at the mill and also after school hours. This strategy is really helping her provide for her family. 

A portion of this loan will help her and her fellow group members who are also teachers to increase production this season so as to generate more income. One of her major need is a motorbike which will help her commute to school and  to the mill. The profit from this loan and her weekly savings with Nke-Anyi Cooperative will be added to her future plans savings.  

Love and her group members thank all Kiva lenders who support their loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Anna Marie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anna Marie has been in her business for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anna Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is married, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Saralyn is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Saralyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase new seeds of rice for her farm.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Saralyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds of rice for her farm.

loans.name: Pedencia

texts.en:
Pedencia is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Pedencia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Pedencia has been in her business for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pedencia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en: In August 2014, eight active women from Namigaon village located in the Titilagarh block of Balangir district, one of the poorest districts of India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family by their contribution. They formed a group named Mahalaxmi to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses Mithila is one of the members who is standing with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and living with her husband, one son who is eight years old and one daughter who is six years old. Mithila hails from a traditional cloth weaving community. Being a member of a weaver family, she has been involved in this work from her childhood. Since her marriage, she has been running a cloth weaving unit with her husband. Presently, she has one handoom for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader in a village of 20 kms away.  80 to 100 pieces are prepared from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. Mithila does the initial processing of the thread to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband fits it to the handloom and weaves the sari. They only weave saris because of the demand for them in the market. Her family works around 8-10 hours a day and weaves one piece of sari on each handloom. Mithila sells her product to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of Rs 6,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. So with the present loan, she wants to buy another handloom weaving machine and thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of her raw material. Mithila wishes to grow her business and save enough to start a cloth store in her village. The other members of this group are also doing small enterprises for which they will take a loan and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing another handloom weaving machine and thread/yarn in bulk for more income.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su nieta, se dedica a la venta de tortillas,  ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso, techo y construir una pared en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de piso cerámico, cemento, laminas, polines, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Maria, who is 55 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their granddaughter. She sells tortillas. She wants to improve her house, installing a floor and a roof and building a wall in the place she is showing in the photograph, but she doesn't have sufficient capital. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to purchase ceramic flooring, cement, metal sheeting, purlins, bricks, and iron and pay for labor so that she and her family can live securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy ceramic flooring, cement, metal sheeting, purlins, bricks, and iron and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for four years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her family. Lina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing net.

Lina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 51 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Teresa has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de campo y padre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría ya que tiene un corral alquilado para albergarlos allí.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para él y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Juan is a man of the countryside and a father of 2 children for whom he has had to face many adversities in his life.  However, he has always had the strength of getting ahead and continuing to move forward with his family.

For a while now, he has wanted to start a business of breeding and selling pigs. This is why he asks for a big economic help, to buy some pigs for breeding since he has a rented pen where he can keep them.

With this new business he will be able to generate income for his family, which means everything to him and he would be able to improve the quality of life for his wife and his children.

He will work everyday to launch his business and to make it a sustainable and profitable activity.

Support a hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
In September 2014, 10 women from Sanpatrapali village of Balangir district in Odisha, India formed a group named Mahalaxmi to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Rina, a headstrong and confident lady, is one of them. She hails from a poor family of the Below Poverty Line category. The lady standing second from right in the photo raising her hand is Rina. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters who are nine and three years old and one son who is five years old.
 
Rina has been running a Tiffin stall for the last 10 years with the hand-holding support of her husband. She prepares items like samosa, vada, potato chips etc., which are very popular in the locality. Rina earns a monthly income of Rs 5,000 from this business. Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and the educational expenses of her children. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.  With the present loan, Rina wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she has to replenish her stock frequently. She also wants to use some portion of the loan to repair her Tiffin stall. Rina hopes to save enough to start a roadside restaurant (Dhaba) and give a better education to her children.

The other nine members of the group are also running small enterprises and want to develop them with their present loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. for her tiffin stall.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years.  She also earns income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Francisca is 50 years old now.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Francisca has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

Milagros successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Milagros's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María es una mujer quiteña de 54 años que ha vivido en la ciudad de Latacunga durante 5 años en una casa arrendada. Tiene un hija del que se siente muy orgullosa, actualmente se encuentra separada de sus esposo pero esta separación no le ha impedido sacar adelante a su hija. Ella se dedica a deleitar el paladar de los turistas, ella vende comidas típicas en Tanicuchi ciudad de Latacunga a parte de esto ella tiene un ingreso adicional y es la crianza de animales esto le ayuda a tener más ingresos para sacar a su hija adelante. Requiere su crédito para la compra de animales como cerdos, pollos alimentos para los mismos.
María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por hacer posible su crecimiento laboral y ayudarle con su economía.
texts.en:
Maria, 54 years old, is a native of Quito who has lived for the last five years in a rented house in the city of Latacunga. She has a daughter that she is very proud of. She is currently separated from her husband but this separation has not prevented her from supporting her daughter.

She makes a living delighting the palate of tourists with traditional meals that she sells in Tanicuchi, city of Latacunga.

She also earns additional income from raising animals. This helps her to raise her daughter.

She is requesting the loan to buy animals such as pigs and chickens, as well as feed for the same.

Maria is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for assisting the progress of her work and helping with her economy.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens. She will increase her income and be able to support her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn, cacao, and quinoa

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sokchea, 35, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is a lovely mother of five single children.  For the last 20 years, she has been involved in agri-business. By owning a farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers, and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. She is able to generate a decent earning to support her family.

Unfortunately, her agri-business seems to be down this season. The crops that she has harvested are insufficient either for sale or household use.  To ensure the availability of food for the whole year, she would like to apply for a loan from KIVA to buy rice as the main food for her family members. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Esteria is 43 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Esteria is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Esteria has been in this business for two years, and she also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 71 years old and married, with three children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Consolacion has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

Consolacion has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, beverages, etc. She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is 44 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mylyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Mylyn has been raising pigs for eight years, and she also earns income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise -- footwear and natural medicines -- for her store.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is 40 years old and has three children attending school. He aims to uplift their status of living and give his family a better life. Aside from being a farmer, he also operates his motorcycle transport business to generate additional income.

He wants to continuously operate his motorcycle to increase his income, but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he would like to access an additional loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Through this financial assistance, Danny believes that he will continuously use his motorcycle and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. Edna has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosa is 47 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Rosa has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 47 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school. Florencia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Florencia has been in business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and married, with two children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additonal items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

Delia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Delia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and shampoo

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
As the farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Hun, 40 years old, is working very hard on the rice field that is located near her house. She has two dependent children and four married children. Her husband, Path, 48, is also a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately USD 4 a day, on average. Being farmers is the main task that they have done since 2000.

In this farming season, Hun is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Santa Lucita

texts.es: La señora Santa Lucita quien tiene 26 años de edad y cuenta con 2 hijos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza hace más de 6 años ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en compra de combos (lociones, perfumes, cremas, maquillajes, etc.) ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y es donde sus clientes tienen  una gran demanda de estos productos para regalos  navideños, de graduación, intercambios de regalos  y logra  vender más sus productos ya que comprándolos por mayor es más económico, su meta es lograr ahorrar y tener poder comprar con eso un pequeño lote y construir su casa ya que donde ella vive es muy pequeño y necesita darles una mejor herencia a sus hijos ya que están pequeños y desea también darles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Santa Lucita, age 26, has two children.  She has been selling cosmetics and beauty products for over six years.  She is requesting her loan to buy combinations of lotions, perfumes, creams, and make-up, etc.  She will do this because the Christmas season is approaching, and that is when there is great customer demand for these products as gifts for Christmas, graduation, and gift exchanges.  She manages to sell more products, and buying them wholesale is more economical.

Her goal is to manage to save, to be able to buy a small piece of land, and to build a house.  The house where she lives is very small, and she needs to give a better inheritance to her children.  They are little, and she also wishes to give them a better education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat, who is 33 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support his family, he has been involved since 1995 with an agricultural business, primarily growing rice, and sells the crops to local dealers. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

For supplementary income, he wants to raise cows in order to resell them when they are big enough. Because there is not enough money, he is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy cows.

He hopes that the support from this loan will help to increase his income. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Chhroeb

texts.en:
Chhroeb, who is 42 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She is the mother of two children. 

She is an active and experienced farmer. By growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers, she can make a decent income to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for almost 15 years. 

Chhroeb wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use.  There is no latrine in her house now. 

Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Celestial

texts.en:
She hails in Mayorga, Leyte. Celestial is 25 years of age and married.  She and her husband has two children, ages 6 and 4 years old.

She raises and sells hogs to earn  for a living. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now.  In addition to that, she engages in  farming. She grows and sells rice. 

These are her sources of income. But still, she encounters financial problem in sustaining her current livelihood.

Celestial  has requested a loan of  PHP 10,000 buy farm supplies like fertilizers, medicine, additional piglets, and pig feed. In this way, she could raise and sell more pigs, improve the yield of her farm, and eventually generate bigger income.  Celestial could afford to buy healthy foods and provide better living condition for her family.

Celestial hopes to expand her both businesses, for the improvement of her livelihood as well as  the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, medicine, additional piglets, and pig feed

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old but has no child yet. Due to the hardships of living, Jane has been engaged in buying and reselling various fruits in her community to supplement her husband income. 

She aims to continue her business and make it profitable, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more stocks of watermelon, pineapples, pomelo, and other kinds of fruits to resell. 

Through her patience and hard work, she hopes that someday, she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of watermelon, pineapple, pomelo, and other kinds of fruits to resell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Amy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Amy's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 50 years old and married, with two children. With one child in school, Clara works very hard to provide for them.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Clara has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Clara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ailyn requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for one year now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, and feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Genoviva

texts.en:
Genoviva has bravely raised her three children alone. She has supported the needs of her children from her sari-sari store business. 

Genoviva has joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for capitalization. She applied for a loan and will use the money for various consumer needs. Recently, she applied to buy groceries for her sari-sari. She wants to increase her inventories of canned goods, milk, sugar, oil, and other basic commodities. 

In the future, Genoviva desires to construct an extension space of her store to accommodate her inventories.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Soknov

texts.en:
Soknov, 29, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children. In the past ten years, she has been involved in agribusiness. On farmland that she owns, she grows rice. She sells the crops to the local dealers, and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. Until now, she has been able to generate decent earnings to support her family.

Unfortunately, her agribusiness seems to be down in this season. The crops that she has harvested are insufficient, either for sale or household use. To ensure the availability of food for the whole year, she would like apply for a loan from Kiva, to buy rice as the main food for her family members. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy rice, so her family can have enough food to eat

loans.name: Mariniel

texts.en:
Mariniel has been operating her grocery store for over seven years to make a living. Her previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully. 

Aside from this, she also is engaged in raising pigs. She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase livestock feed and construction materials to build a pig fence for business improvement. 

he plans to buy more additional piglets to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and construction materials for a pig fence

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Las calles de Sololá es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las mostacias  artesanales.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar estos productos, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. De 42 años de edad soltera Rosenda es un ejemplo en tener vivo las culturas de Guatemala, ella es una mujer emprendedora que no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que a ella se le presentan sino ella busca alternativas para salir adelante.

La actividad que ella dignamente realiza es la elaboración de mostacias artesanales ella ha venido realizando desde hace mas de 8 años ya que para ella es algo que le gusta hacer, para tener un ingreso económico par el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida par ella y su familia, con los ingresos económicos que ella obtiene de sus ventas de dicha actividad que realiza mejora el futuro de su comunidad.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo  que ella está realizando es para la compra de productos  e  insumos de mostacias artesanales, para exhibir mejor sus productos a las personas turísticas que visitan el lugar donde ella está ubicada en su comunidad. Uno de los sueños de Rosenda es la ampliación de su negocio y la realización de más productos artesanales para poder brindarles un buen servicio a las personas que lo visitan.
texts.en:
The streets of Sololá are witnesses to the most attractive colors that pervade handcrafted beads.  It is impossible for any tourist to not admire these products, to stop, and to make a good purchase.

Rosenda, age 42, is single.  She is an example of keeping the culture of Guatemala alive.  She is an enterprising woman that does not give up when faced with obstacles.  She looks for alternatives in order to get ahead.

The business activity that she honorably engages in is making handcrafted beads.  She has been doing this for over eight years.  It is something that she likes to do in order to have income to support her family and to improve her living conditions and those of her family.  With the earnings that she gets from her sales she improves the community’s future.

The reason for the loan she is requesting is to buy products and supplies for handcrafted beads in order to better display her products to the tourists who visit the place where she is located in her community.  

One of Rosenda’s dreams is to expand her business and to make more handcrafted products.  She wants to do this in order to be able to provide good service to the people who visit her business.

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for handcrafted beads.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 37 years old and married, with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase a larger stock of goods to sell, like gallons of cooking oil, soap, shampoo, etc. Bonifacia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a larger stock of goods to sell, like gallons of cooking oil, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Sin’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Sin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ritcel

texts.en: Ritcel is a hardworking mother to her only child. At the age of 34, she busies herself with her upholstery business. She has sought financial assistance from Paglaum MPC and enjoyed the various programs and services that the cooperative has extended to her. Recently, she wanted to expand her business by making bags. She applied for a loan to buy materials for bag making, such as leather and threads. Ritcel deeply wishes to double her income so she can save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as leather and thread, for bag making

loans.name: Rosena

texts.en: In 2011, Rosena signed up for her membership with PMPC. She is from Pagadian, is married, and has three children. She is a stay-at-home mother and raises pigs in her backyard for animal sales. She finds her business easy with feeding the pigs and keeping the pig pens clean at all times. With the demands of her customers, Rosena wanted to buy three heads of piglets and three sacks of feed. She applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. In the future, she hopes to construct bigger concrete pig pens to easily manage her growing pigs.

loans.use: to buy three heads of piglets and three sacks of feed

loans.name: Srey On

texts.en: Srey On is 18 years old, and she is a university student in a city. For her major, she has been taking banking and finance. Because she is a freshman who lacks finances to pay her tuition fees for four years, Srey On has decided to apply for a loan. With the loan, she will be able to graduate successfully, with her favorite skill, and build a good future. Her dream is to find a good job in a bank, and then save money to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees in Banking and Finance

loans.name: Leizyl

texts.en:
Leizyl is 36 years old and single. Leizyl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc., to sell.

Leizyl has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. In the future, Leizyl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Consolata is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Consolata has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Consolata is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 5.5 acres will be planted by Consolata's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 44 years old and married, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like soft drinks, chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc. Catherine has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Catherine aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soft drinks, chips, bread, canned goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De San Lorenzo En Cubo Group

texts.es: El dúo Mujeres de san Lorenzo está integrado por doña Catarina de 63 años quien es viuda y se dedica a la elaboración de muñequitos quitapenas y  a la siembra de camote y manía  este es el 6to crédito que ella solicita para la compra de materiales para elaborar sus muñequitos quitapenas (alambre, sí baque, esponja, retaso, medias, Resistol, higo etc.) y otra parte del crédito lo solicita para la siembra de camote para pagar  la mano de obra para cultivarlo ella esta agradecida ya que esto le ha podido ayudar a solventar y tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus necesidades y poder tener un ahorro para su futuro más adelante.
texts.en:
The duo "Mujeres de San Lorenzo" (Women of San Lorenzo) was formed by Doña Catarina, who is 63 years old and a widow. She makes worry dolls and raises sweet potatoes and peanuts. This is the 6th loan that she has applied for. It is for the purchase of materials to make her worry dolls (wire, rings, sponges, remnants, stockings, glue, thread, etc.), and another part of the loan she requested is to plant sweet potatoes and to pay for labor to raise them. 

She is grateful since this has been able to help her to have an economic income to pay for her necessities and to be able to have  savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to make worry dolls

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is a businesswoman from Pagadian who has a store where she sells office and school supplies and other merchandise. She is the mother of three children and works hard to provide for their needs. She has requested a loan to buy additional items to sell, especially pads of paper and reams of bond paper. She hopes to boost her income so that she can afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: to buy additiional school and office supplies to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en: Vianney is a father who has mastered his baking skills. He has started his own bakery in Pagadian. He has sought capital from PMPC and applied for a loan to purchase baking ingredients like flour, sugar and butter. Vianney wishes to become successful in his business and would love to see his family with improved living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients like flour, sugar and butter

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita busies herself through her livestock activities. She has chickens that lay eggs for commercial sales. She is thankful that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) has helped her in her capitalization. She is able to expand her business and has increased the number of her laying chickens. 

Recently, Tita applied for a loan to purchase growing and laying mash for chicken-raising. She hopes to increase her income and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mash for chicken-raising.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She sells 'ukay-ukay' (used clothing) in the neighborhood and has a stall in the market. She earns well on her chosen business and has saved enough money for the needs of her family. 

She is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has applied her first loan to purchase more bundles of used clothing to sell. Anita wishes to increase her sales, so that she can afford to buy a multi-cab for transportation of her inventories.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothing to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, ha mantenido su venta de tortillas, antojitos, verduras y granos básicos en el mercado con el apoyo que le brinda la institución y los inversionistas Kiva a través de préstamos. Sus ganancias son mejores y las utiliza para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y pagar su deuda.
Hace la solitud de un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en maíz, leña, gas propano, granos básicos y otros productos necesarios para tener surtido su negocio, su objetivo es mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia has kept up with her sales of tortillas, snacks, vegetables, and basic grains at the market with the support provided by the institution and by Kiva lenders through loans. Her profits have improved and she will use this to pay for her family’s basic necessities and to pay her debt.

She is requesting a new loan to invest in corn, firewood, propane gas, basic grains, and other products she needs to stock up her business. Her goal is to maintain her business.

loans.use: to invest in corn, firewood, propane gas, basic grains, and other products she needs to stock up her business.

loans.name: Mohiston

texts.ru: Мохистону 36 лет. Она уроженка не большого городка под названием Турсунзаде. Городок был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя, героя Республики Таджикистана Мирзо Турсунзаде. Мохистон замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. Воспитанием детей занимается одна Мохистон. Она сидит дома, занимается домашними делами, но успевает брать заказы на шитье женской одежды. Она хотела бы работать дальше и продвигать швейное дело, но есть технические проблемы, по которым ее швейная машинка не работает и Мохистон вынуждена обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить новую машинку. Ей не хватает маленькой суммы. Помогите Мохистону собрать недостающую сумму.
texts.en: Mohiston is 36 years old.  She is a native of the small city of Tursunzoda, which is named in honor of the famous writer and national hero of the Republic of Tajikistan, Mirzo Tursunzoda.  Mohiston is married and she has three children.  Her husband is currently working abroad, so Mohiston raises her children alone.  Mohiston stays home, takes care of the household, but she also finds the time to take orders and sew women's clothes.  She would like to work more and expand her sewing business, but she is currently facing some technical problems, as her sewing machine is not working.  She has therefore applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  She is only lacking a small amount of money.  Please help her get the money that she needs!

loans.use: to buy a "YAMATA" sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel , 43 years old, is married with five children and has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this.  She had successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients in order to have a productive harvest. She is now happy to say that with this loan the entire farm will be fertilized and she will be assured of a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients in order to have a productive harvest.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 38 years old, is married and has three children. She has a retail business to make an income for a living. She earns a good income from this business and was able to sustain it and make some home improvements with the profits. Her previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store. She hopes to expand her business and build a bigger shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Nany

texts.en:
Nany is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nany is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Nany has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Nany requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Nany has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nany would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is 47 years old and married, with one child. She earns a living by farming calamansi in the Philippines.

Ma. Editha is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming calamansi for 25 years, and she earns additional income from broom-making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
