Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo. Gilberto de 37 años de edad unido, el motivo por el cual el está impulsado en realizar otro préstamo es para una nueva inversión el cultivo de zanahorias.

Los préstamos eran con otras instituciones, pero no contaban con los beneficios que nos da adicla, como lo es la forma de pago, intereses mensuales y el capital al vencimiento pues son beneficios que nos ayudan a soñar en un futuro mejor para nuestros futuros hijos.

El uso respectivo que dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de zanahorias y abonos orgánicos e químicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrido con Gilberto que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.

Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casa para su hijo para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para su hijo para que se convierta en profesional en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Gilberto works the land under a grueling sun, ready to sweat all of the time in order to provide his son with a better future.  He is 37 years old, and is requesting this new loan to make a new investment in the cultivation of carrots.  He's taken loans with other institutions, but they have not given him the same benefits that he is getting with ADICLA, such as the form of the payments, low monthly interest rates, and payment of principal at maturity.  These are benefits that help us to dream of having a better future for our children.  

Gilberto will use this second loan to buy carrot seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers so that he can start cultivating more products to later sell in the market in his community.  This way, he can obtain more earnings to support his family and give them suitable living conditions.  

The difference that a loan makes is mainly that one can guarantee his harvest with the supplies and with the general management of his crops.  This way, farmers can obtain better quality products.  This is what happened to Gilberto through the loans that he was granted before; he was able to obtain better harvests.

One of Gilberto's goals is to build a house for his son so that he can have suitable living conditions, and he also wants to provide his son with an education so that he can become a professional in life.  Gilberto also wants to continue to farm the fertile land of his community.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Norma Rodeh

texts.en: Norma is married, and her husband has earned a living for many years by selling ice cream. They have lived in the same house for the last 22 years, and while her children are grown and independent, they remain a close-knit family. She says that she started selling clothing 36 years ago with help from her mother. Norma is seeking a loan to buy items to sell in the busy end-of-year season. She describes her family as strong, healthy, without vices and hard working. She likes going to church every Sunday to say thanks for all the things that she has.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm fronds from which to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is a businesswoman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 47, single and runs a small sari-sari or variety store. She also owns a carenderia or small restaurant. Her business is lucrative and her income is good. However, she wants to improve her store so that she will be able to cater to more customers. Jasmin is requesting to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and condiments. With this loan, she will be able to increase her inventory, thus attracting more buyers and customers to both her store and restaurant. In the future, she hopes to make her business a bigger success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is operating a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of merchandise like noodles, canned goods, soap, eggs, cooking oil, shampoo, and beverages. She has been operating a store for four years, now. She is married and has four grown children. She is fifty-four years old and resides in Tagbilaran City, Bohol.

Narcisa has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use this amount to purchase additional stock for her store, like detergents, groceries, and soft drinks. In the coming months, her store will be filled with various stock, which will attract more consumers to buy. Once she is earning more with this, she could possibly roll her capital into other business opportunities and be able to pay her daily expenses.

Narcisa would like to improve her current business, to be sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, like detergents, groceries, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Rodelyn wants to engage in reselling fruits and vegetables in her community. She is 37 years old and has three, schooling children. She aims to make this business profitable and generate sufficient income to provide their necessities and finance the education of her children. Having insufficient capital, she wants to avail herself of an additional loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase watermelons, pineapples, rattan fruits, and vegetables to resell. Through this financial assistance, Rodelyn believes that someday, she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, pineapples, rattan fruits, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza, manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha sido de gran apoyo para mejorar el inventario de su negocio, su núcleo familiar se mantiene y su situación económica ha mejorado.
Consiente de tener una mayor demanda opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, huevos, verduras, especias, etc., para continuar preparando la comida, tendrá clientes satisfechos y seguirá progresando.
texts.en:
Maritza states that the previous loan has been a great support for the improvement of the inventory of her business, her nuclear family continues on, and her economic situation has improved.

Aware of having a larger demand, she is opting for a new loan to purchase rice, oil, beans, eggs, vegetables, spices, etc., to continue preparing food. She will have satisfied customers and will continue progressing.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, beans, eggs, vegetables, spices, etc., to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 29 years old, married, and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

Nilda has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en: Romelita works hard to support her family by running a dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like curtains, blouses, T-shirts, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for five years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena works hard to support her family by making brooms in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business. She has been in her current line of work for two years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчон родился в 1973 году в древнем городе Истаравшан в семье рабочего. Мухаммадчон очень жизнерадостный мужчина и любящий отец. Мухаммадчон женат и имеет 4х детей. Они живут дружно. Он стремится вместе с  женой воспитать своих детей хорошими людьми. Мухаммадчон мастер по профессии. Он работает на стройке мастером штукатуром. Мухаммадчон впервые обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. Он хочет оплатить договор на обучение своей дочки в университете.  Заранее благодарит за доверии и поддержку.
texts.en: Muhammadjon was born in 1973 in the old city of Istaravshan, in a simple workers' family.  He is a man with a very positive attitude toward life and a beloved father.  He is married and he has four children.  The family gets along well.  He and his wife strive to raise their children so that they become good people.  Muhammadjon is a foreman by training; he works in construction as a master plasterer.  This is the first time that he is taking a loan from MDO Arvand.  He will use this loan to pay for his daughter's university tuition fees.  He thanks you in advance for your trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's higher education costs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita owns and operates a grocery store, to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and get more capital. The goods she purchased with her previous loan from GDMPC, helped to increase her sales. She had planned to expand her offerings. Her previous loan was repaid successfully, because she earned better income from this.

She took a new loan recently, to purchase rice and corn grits, in addition to her stock for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate their house, for a safer and more comfortable place to live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits, in addition to her stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs, fertilizer, and pay workers to help him cultivate corn

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло замужняя женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она живет в маленьком городке Турсунзаде, который был назван в честь великого писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. Шахло дома занимается шитьем разной одежды и принимает заказы. Она дорожит своей работой, ведь для нее швейная деятельность очень важный и надобный источник дохода. Шахло меньше всего хотелось бы потерять работу, но это может случиться, потому что ее швейная машинка сломалась и не выполняет свои функции. У нее остается только обратиться за кредитом для приобретения новой машинки. Ее сбережения не позволяют ей самостоятельно купить машинку, и она видит выход только в получении кредита.
texts.en: Shahlo is a 30-year-old married woman.  She lives in the small city of Tursunzoda, named in honor of the famous writer, Mirzo Tursunzoda.  She works from home, taking orders to sew various types of clothes.  She likes her job: her sewing activity is very important to her and a welcome source of income.  The last thing that Shahlo wants is to lose her job.  However, this might happen, because her sewing machine is currently broken and no longer fulfills its functions.  The only thing that Shahlo can do is apply for a loan and buy a new sewing machine.  Her savings are not sufficient to make this type of purchase, so her only option is to receive a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonarda Ermelinda

texts.es: Doña Leonarda, tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Trujillo, Colon junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedicaba a la producción de palma africana y hace dos años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como es manteca, churros, condimentos, arroz, azúcar, huevos, pan, sal, jabón y otros abarrotes. Ella quiere capitalizar su negocio y tenerlo surtido con mas productos para eso ha solicitado un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras y va comprar harina, arroz, azúcar, manteca, pan, huevos, churros, refrescos, productos de aseo, etc. para la venta. Su plan es seguir invirtiendo para hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 57, is married and resides in a hamlet that belongs to the Municipality of Trujillo, Colon, along with her husband and children.  She makes a living in the production of African palm and two years ago she established a shop where she sells basic household products such as lard, fritters, condiments, rice, sugar, eggs, bread, soap, and other groceries.
She wishes to capitalize her business and have it stocked with more products.  For this reason, she has requested a loan of 25,000 lempiras and she will buy flour, rice, lard, bread, eggs, fritters, soft drinks, cleaning products, etc. to sell.  Her plan is to continue investing in order to make it grow.

loans.use: to stock with products such as flour, rice, sugar, lard, bread, eggs, fritters, soft drinks, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 45 years old and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work, for buildings. In this regard, her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets, for manufacturing Iron accessories. This would improve his shuttering work, and in turn would enable him to generate more income for the financial support of his family.

Kishwar is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner, for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's work, making shutters for buildings

loans.name: Jennyline

texts.en: Having no other source of income, Jennyline is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables along the public highway. She is now 33 years old.  She is married but has no children yet. She hopes to make her business viable and profitable in order to help her husband provide for their daily necessities. Due to insufficient capital, she wants to borrow 6,000 PHP in order to buy various fruits and vegetables to stock and to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work, for buildings. In this regard, her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets, for manufacturing iron accessories. This would improve his shuttering work, and in turn would enable him to generate more income for the financial support of his family.

Rani is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner, for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's work, making shutters for buildings.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is age 29.  She is a mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc.  He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Tahira requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Tahira hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way.  This amount will help him to cope with the demands of the family. Tahira thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 56-year-old lady, living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living conditions for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her son has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years.  His income is insufficient to feed his entire family.  He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.  Therefore, Hamida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son will be able to buy the motor rickshaw's body. 

She hopes that she will be able to make enough saving till the time comes for her children to marry in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motor rickshaw's body for her son.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is forty-one years old and a married woman. She lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is engaged in a mineral water-vending business. She sells mineral water; every container has a capacity of five gallons. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years. She and her husband have seven dependents. Six of them are still attending school. Her husband's occupation is a fisherman.

Margarita has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional empty containers, as additional capital to finance her current business. This would be a big help for Margarita, especially in re-establishing her livelihood. She could deliver more gallons of mineral water to her respective clients, and eventually gain higher earnings.

Margarita would like to expand her business, to be successful, and to be able to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional empty containers, as additional capital to finance her current business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet and sanitary system for his house so that his family enjoys better living conditions.

loans.name: Mubeen

texts.en:
Mubeen is a 45-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time. 

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Mubeen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Mubeen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: To buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo for sheltering services.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma operates a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, seasonings, noodles, biscuits, soap, and canned goods. 

Gemma is a forty-seven-year-old married mother of three grown children. She has been operating her sari-sari for five years already. Her husband is a driver by occupation.
 
Gemma has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to buy assorted groceries, rice, and soft drinks to stock her store. Hopefully in the coming months, her sari-sari will be filled with merchandise, thus attracting more consumers.

In the long run, Gemma will continue to manage her business and invest any possible profits in her store. She also hopes to be able to cover her household's expenses, thus providing healthy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, rice, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying daily fare, because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children have grown older, and their needs have grown, as well. He worried for many days about how to be free from daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Lubna has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing it, the money became short. Therefore, Lubna requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of the savings. She hopes that now her husband does not have any need to pay daily fare, which was the cause of expenditures. Lubna is a 27-year-old woman, living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Lubna hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income, because now he will not pay daily fare to anyone. Lubna is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw (with her savings added to the loan), for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Jinky Mary

texts.en:
Jinky Mary is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She earns a living by selling crude oil. Crude oil is used to power motorized fishing boats, in her place. Jinky Mary has been in the business for more than two years, now. Her husband earns a supplemental income, through fishing.

Jinky Mary is asking for a loan to buy more crude oil. This loan will help her increase her stock of crude oil, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Jinky Mary hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more crude oil

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a 54-year-old-married mother of two grown children. She lives in Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines where she runs a small sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Erlita has been running her business for more than 4 years now. 

Erlita is requesting a loan in order to buy more inventory like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, beverages, noodles, soap and detergents, toiletries, biscuits, and snack foods. With this loan, Erlita will be able to improve the merchandise she has available, thus attracting more buyers to her sari-sari.
 
In the future, Erlita hopes to make her business both sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as canned goods, rice, soft drinks, beverages, noodles, soap and detergent, toiletries, biscuits, and snack foods.

loans.name: Solidario Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO LUZ DIVINA
Doña Elba Rosmery es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 24 años de edad, y  bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad uno de 6 años, uno de 4 años y uno de 1 año ella se dedica a la Artesanías y a la crianza de pollos, en su casa ubicada en Tecpan.
El esposo de ella trabaja como carpintero y gracias al apoyo de el, ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante. Gracias a dios su negocio poco a poco a crecido ya que ella empezó con un negocio muy pequeño y ahora a podido crecer con su negocio.
Ella sueña con  ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Elba Rosmery is a native of Tecpan. She is 24 years old, and her 3 minor children, who are 6, 4, and 1 years old, are under her care. She makes a living making crafts and raising chickens in her house, which is located in Tecpan. Her husband works as a  carpenter. As a result of his support, she is able to succeed with her business, which is the means through which she moves forward.

Thanks to God, her business has grown little by little. She started with a very small business, and now she is able to grow with her business. She dreams of expanding her business further in order to obtain greater earnings and send her children to school so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw material in order to make and sell typical textiles.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: Anderson is forty-eight years old and married. He has eight children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. For fourteen years he has been in service, teaching. He joined the service with the aim of helping the nation. Anderson is also a farmer, growing crops such as maize, cotton, beans, and others, to earn extra income. Anderson has a dream of educating his children, though he is faced with a challenge of low salary payments. Anderson will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 46-year-old married mother of 7 children. She lives in Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines, where she has a sari-sari, or variety store, and sells various goods and items to her community. Helen has been running her business for more than 10 years now. 

Helen has requested a loan in order to buy more inventory such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, soap and toiletries, dried fish, and condiments. This loan will help Helen improve her sari-sari's inventory and attract more customers.

In the future, Helen hopes to make her business productive and self-sufficient. Moreover, she wishes to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, soap and toiletries, dried fish, and condiments to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this business. With her previous loan used to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest. She plans to build a farm warehouse in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is aged 34 and a married, hardworking woman. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children, and four of them attend school. Annet deals in produce in Hoima, Uganda, mainly buying and selling maize, rice, and beans, among others. She desires to expand and develop her business, but she is challenged by high transport costs. She will use the loan facility to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George used the previous loan to buy land, for settlement of his family. George is forty-four years old and married. He has six children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. George is a teacher by profession, and also he practices farming. He grows crops such as maize, rice, cotton and others, to supplement his salary.

George has a dream of educating his children. However, he is faced with the challenge of a long distance between work and home. George wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 36 years old.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her five children and her spouse. 

Naseem has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but, at the time of purchase, she was short some money. Therefore, she has requested a loan so that, with the contribution of her savings, her husband can buy a new auto rickshaw. She had previously received a loan but she could not buy a rickshaw for her husband due to household expenses. This time, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw with the loan and her savings.

She hopes that this time her husband can easily generate sufficient income to provide for his children and pay the installments on time. She is very happy after receiving this loan and she thanks kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda, 45 years old, is married and a resident of San Pedro, Dapitan City, Philippines. Her husband works as a fisherman, and the fish he catches are sold either at the public market or to their neighbors. 

Reynelda and her husband have been in this business for many years already. And now, since she wants to be more productive, she has decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. 

On May 14, 2008 both Reynelda and her husband agreed to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to be able to access a loan to buy fishing nets. But, aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed add-on benefits such as insurance and savings.  

Reynelda has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to be able to purchase her fish for resale. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she will be able to one day become a successful vendor and to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Jose Porfirio

texts.es:
José, cuida de su núcleo familiar integrado por su esposa y dos hijos que están estudiando; él es pastor de una iglesia desde hace 4 años, sus actividades económicas son cultivo de granos básicos, oficio que aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña desde hace 7 años de manera independiente y la venta de semilla de marañón se la enseñaron algunas amistades.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para cultivar frijol y comprara semilla de marañón, fortalecerá su negocio, trabajará sin inconvenientes, su productividad será mayor por tanto los ingresos aumentaran y podrá responder al compromiso de su deuda.
Sus sueños son construir su vivienda propia, apoyar para construcción de la iglesia, dar a sus hijos un mejore estilo de vida y seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose takes care of his household, which is made up of his wife and his two children who are in school. He has been the pastor of a Church for the past 4 years. He makes a living cultivating basic grains, a job that he learned from his parents. He has been doing this work independently for the past 7 years. A few friends taught him to sell cashew nuts. 

He will buy agricultural supplies to cultivate beans as well as cashew seeds in order to strengthen his business. He will work without inconveniences, and his productivity will increase. Therefore, he will earn a higher income and pay back his loan. He dreams of building his own house, supporting the construction of a church, giving his children a better quality of life, and continuing to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate beans and to buy cashew seeds in order to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 34 years old.  She is the mother of six children and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in the sale of dairy products like milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from the earnings from the milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients.

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through the milk sales business. So, Salma decided to request a loan. In this way, she can provide support to her husband’s business.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's milk sales shop.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is aged 28 and a widow. She is the mother of two children, and she lives with her parents, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her brother is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town, for many years. Her brother offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding the whole family, through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis, so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. So, Asma requested a loan, so that her brother would be able to buy more vegetables to sell. Asma is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her brother's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of khal chokar (fodder) for her husband's business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina has switched from selling snacks to selling "talaba" (mussels) for culturing. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own "talaba" (mussels) for culturing. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she availed another loan from PMPC was to buy more "talaba" (mussels) for culturing. 

Today, Rosalina is able to help others do a retailing business on her "talaba", and they also have earned well for their own family.

loans.use: to buy more "talaba" (mussels) for culturing

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Euphemia's Group

texts.en:
Euphemia is 42 years old, and has seven children. She is a group leader, and is representing her group, formed by seven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Euphemia has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Euphemia also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Euphemia's Group will be able to receive a total of two solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 57, a resident of Fairview, Quezon City, Philippines. Married to Ludivico, they have three children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income to meet the family’s daily personal and household needs and the education of her children. 

Merlinda buys fresh meat and frozen foods from a wholesaler and sells them at retail price. She has been in this business for a number of years already and she makes a good income. She is a sincere and honest woman so she already has quite a number of regular customers in her area.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan, which she will use to buy more kilos of fish, chicken, pork, hotdog, "embutido", and "longanisa" to meet the increased demand this Christmas Season. She is thanking God in advance for increased sales and the financial help that will be given her, for it will greatly help sustain their daily needs and the school needs of her children.

Merlinda hopes to be able to grow her business and dreams that all her children will earn a college degree so they have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fresh meat such as chicken, fish, and pork and frozen foods such as hotdog, "longanisa" and embotido to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 51 years old and lives with her spouse and five children in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a butcher and his forefathers and relatives have been selling meat for many years. Butchery is traditional work.  He learned the arts regarding the slaughter of the animals and the division of the carcass from his father.  He is earning a reasonable income for his entire family.
 
In the beginning, he purchased a little quantity of beef from the market and then sold it in his locality from the butcher shop. The customers were upset due to stale beef from being many days old. He does not want to compromise over his quality and reputation. This is the reason why he wants to produce fresh beef and wants to buy a bull calf for producing more beef to sell but he does not have enough cash on hand.

For this is the reason, Safia contacted Kiva’s field partner and, after understanding all the procedures, she has requested a Kiva loan, so that her son can buy a bull calf. She hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for her son's butcher shop.

loans.use: to help her son purchase a bull calf.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is responsible, and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

Janette applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. 

This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been a microfinance member since 2013. She has availed loans, and has made prompt payments. She has managed her farming activities well, and desires expand by cultivating another rice land. 

Recently, she availed another loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer. With the financial help extended by PMPC, Josephine has made enough savings and has improved their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana, who is married to a barber, wants a loan in order to help her husband setup a barber shop. The loan would be used to buy items like scissors for cutting hair, water sprayers, seats and a mirror. Unable to make ends meet, the new setup would generate enough earnings to help Ramzana come out of difficult financial times. Moreover, Ramzana's husband plans to expand his barber shop buy inserting more seats and hiring more personnel who would assist him in cutting hair. 

This loan is extremely important for the flow of income into Ramzana's home, enabling her to meet the basic requirements of her household.

loans.use: to help her husband setup a barber shop.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 46 years old, and a married mother of five children; she is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Edith has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Edith wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Edith hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light, as, even though Edith decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Winstone's Group

texts.en:
Winstone is a 56-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader and is often described as a very experienced farmer. He is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Winstone has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Winstone described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Winstone’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, an industrious mother, is making a profit through her sari-sari (general store) store business. She is 56 years old and married. She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her family. Lolita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Lolita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales.

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 48 years old and married. He has 5 children.

Alfred likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Alfred plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Alfred’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7 acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan. The group will receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Doda

texts.en:
Doda is a 59-year-old married woman, and the mother of four grown-up children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a furniture making business for more than 10 years now. 

Doda wants to expand her business, but lacks the financial resources to do. She is requesting a loan to buy more wood, nails, and varnish, and to pay for the labor. With this, she will be able to improve their output, thus allowing them to sell more to the market.

In the future, Doda hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more wood, nails, and varnish, and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Kongneou

texts.en:
Kongneou is a 24-year-old single student from Kampong Cham province. He is taking a banking and finance major at a university in a city. In order to support his study, he has also worked at a kid center. Being on staff, Kongneou can earn approximately $5 per day. 

Now he is in his second year at the university, and since he is lacking finances to pay his tuition fee for the first semester, he decided to request a loan.

This loan will help him finish the first semester of the second year successfully. After graduation, Kongneou wants to be on a bank staff in the city.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Jessica has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Jessica wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Salud successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Salud's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
This nice woman in the photo is Varsenik, from Kapan town. She makes her living by making and selling cakes and cookies. Since 2010, Varsenik was able to gain many customers, especially her neighbors in the town. 

To be able to purchase new oven, which she badly needs for her production business, Varsenik has applied for this loan. It will also greatly assist her to purchase design materials for cakes, and ingredients for making different cookies. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Varsenik relies on lenders' goodwill and support for her small production business.

loans.use: to pay for an oven, and design materials for cakes, and ingredients for making different cookies

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ann, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. She is 48 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Ann is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Ann says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Ann will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, water and spirits to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha has been helping her husband in working their own farm to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to spray the farm. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm. So she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm to have a more productive harvest. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm because she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants and foot wear to sell.

Teresita successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Teresita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants and foot wear

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 70 years old and married with three children.

Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Catalina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William is 70 years old, and is often referred to as a really experienced farmer. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega South District, formed by five farmers, including himself.

William has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2010 because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

With this loan, William’s Group will receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom is a 57-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Tom has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Tom described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, as well as fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Tom’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bithia's Group

texts.en:
Bithia is a 50-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Bithia has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Bithia described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Bithia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Inmer Josue

texts.es:
Inmer es panificador, vive con sus padres de 50 y 49 años de edad y sus hermanos de 19 y 20 años de edad; trabaja en su panadería todos los días, su familia le apoya en el negocio, el producto lo distribuye en la zona donde vive y en sus alrededores, posee 7 bicicletas, 2 motos y 2 vehículos para hacer la entrega de los pedidos.
Con el capital comprará diferentes harinas, levadura, azúcar, manteca, entre otros ingredientes para la elaboración de pan, será de utilidad para fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su situación financiera.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio con vida e ir mejorando económicamente para tener un mejor estilo de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Inmer is a baker. He lives with his parents, who are 50 and 49 years old, and with his siblings, who are 19 and 20 years old. He works in his bakery every day. His family supports his business. He distributes his products in the area where he lives and in its surroundings. He has 7 bicycles, 2 motorcycles, and 2 vehicles to deliver the orders. 

With this loan, he will buy a variety of flours, yeast, sugar, and butter, among other ingredients, in order to make bread. This will allow him to strengthen his business and to improve his financial situation. He dreams of keeping his business alive and of improving financially so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of flours, yeast, sugar, and butter, among other ingredients, in order to make bread.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's Group is formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, and is being represented by Judith, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 43 years old, is married, and has four children. Judith has been a farmer for 17 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Judith isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Judith will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Judith's Group will purchase a total of three solar lights, and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Emilly's Group

texts.en:
Emilly, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Emilly is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Emilly has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this coming season, Emilly is planning to send her children to school.

A total of seven acres will be planted by Emilly's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Binura

texts.en:
Binura, who is in her early 50s, is single, with five children.  Two of them are big, and three of them are still in school.  

She has been selling clothes for eight years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Binura's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stocks of fabrics, sarongs and ladies' and men's clothes.  

She will use his loan to buy more stocks of clothes to resell.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.   

She dreams of building her own house.  Binura will make sure she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store in her place. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. A year ago, a super typhoon ruined her business forcing her to stop.

As of now, she has just started to operate her store again. Edna needs additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods. With this loan, Edna will be able to increase the stock in her store, which will give her more opportunities to serve more customers.
 
In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business so that it will generate more revenue. Edna also wants to save money to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

Virgilia successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Virgilia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is the 30-year-old married mother of five children. 

Due to her husband's limited income, she started fifteen years ago working as a manicurist from her house to pay the expenses and needs of her family. Lately she started teaching and working in a stationery to satisfy her children's increasing living costs.

Nariman is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is sacrificing to keep her family in a good living situation. 

Today, Nariman is acquiring a YOUTH loan to expand her manicure business by buying new nail polish colors, as she wants to buy make-up to start working as make-up artist, too. 

Nariman hopes to develop her business and open her own beauty salon shop to increase her income and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new nail polish colors and make-up

loans.name: Shem's Group

texts.en:
Shem is 83 years old and has six children. He is a group leader, representing a group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Shem has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to the best seed prices.  Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Shem also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about.  It will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Shem's group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and have capital to start a food vending business

loans.name: Eltan's Group

texts.en:
Etlan is a 64-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Etlan has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Etlan described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Etlan’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and earn higher capital. After purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC, she increased her sales and she planned to expand her offerings. Her previous loan was repaid successfully for she earned better income.  She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feed to add to her inventory. She plans to use the income generated from the business to renovate their house for a safer live and to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feed to add to her inventory

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a designer. He specializes in the linear design of buildings, garages and houses. 

Armen lives with his wife in Kapan town and due to his high professionalism, he receives a number of orders during the month. He has applied for this loan to ask lenders to help him to purchase measurement equipment, which he needs for providing linear designs of buildings. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for measurement equipment for providing linear designs of buildings

loans.name: Noel's Group

texts.en:
Noel is a 50-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Noel has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Noel described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to N/A. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Noel’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Mary is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Mary has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Mary is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 4 acres will be planted by Mary's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married with two children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with his family. 

He grows and harvests rice, work that he has done since he was young. He gets up early and has to go to the fields where he has to oversee his crops.  

He took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and to serve as start-up capital for hog raising (to buy feeds and piglets). He plans to buy a vehicle to use for his transportation from farm to market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to buy feeds and piglets to start a pig raising business

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Barbara is a hardworking woman. She makes a living through her food vending business. She has a small restaurant or carenderia in her place. She has been in the business for more than five years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soft drinks, and noodles. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food to her customers.

In the future, Barbara hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, condiments, soft drinks, and noodles.

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice is a 59-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Mourice has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Mourice described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Mourice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eubelen

texts.en:
Eubelen is married with one child. She grows and harvests fruits and other crops, which is work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her livestock as well as her crops. 

Eubelen is requesting this loan to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer to improve her farm. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to give her child the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer to improve her farm

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joyce has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Joyce described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Joyce’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, a musician by profession, is involved in a retail business. Besides her work in a local music school as a teacher of the piano, Emma also trades in perfumery from her house. She receives orders from her customers (mostly neighbours) and acquires stock for them from Yerevan town. 

Emma lives and works in Kapan town with her husband and two children (the eldest is 10 and the youngest is 4 years old). 

Emma has applied for this loan to be able to acquire a new stock of perfumes and cosmetics to meet her customers' demands. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Emma greatly hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of perfumes and cosmetics for selling to customers

loans.name: Herman's Group

texts.en:
Herman, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 68 years old, is married and has 10 children.

Herman likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Herman plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Herman’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 11.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Solomon's Group

texts.en:
Solomon, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 74 years old, married and has nine children.

Solomon likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Solomon plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Solomon’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Jackline, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four children. Jackline has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Jackline isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jackline will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jackline's Group will purchase a total of 19 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
Jesca is a 46-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jesca has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Jesca described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Jesca’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 37 years old and lives in the village Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. Over the years farming and agricultural activities, along with the care of her family, have been her main vocation.

On her farm Hasmik takes care of three cows, a calf, a heifer and twenty chickens. She says she has many loyal customers for her pure and tasty milk and fresh eggs; she nourishes her three school-age children with this output as well. She works all day and has her share of hardships but manages to meet her family’s needs.

Hasmik would like to expand her farm. To this end she is applying for a 400,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon to buy a calf as well as much-needed fodder for her animals during the winter months ahead.

loans.use: to buy a calf as well as much-needed fodder for her animals during the winter months ahead.

loans.name: Meshack's Group

texts.en:
Meshack, pictured above, has eight children, and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the  leader of his group. Meshack is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Meshack has been a farmer for 20 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Meshack is planning to invest in a business.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Meshack's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 55 years old, married and has five children. She likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been a farmer for twenty years and is now proud to represent her group of ten farmers in Kakamega South District.

Beginning this year Hellen became involved with the One Acre Fund. She decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has resulted in increased profits from each harvest.

Hellen’s Group will receive seeds and fertilizers to cultivate a total of six acres of land, plus onsite agricultural training and insurance options. The group will also be buying four solar-powered lights for those members requesting them.

Hellen plans to use the profits from this coming season’s crops to rent more land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest

loans.name: Violito

texts.en:
Violito is 39, and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Wilma and has one child. His wife takes care of their child. He works hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of his child. 

Violito has been in the food business for ten years already. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. The working class usually buy their meals at food stalls; the meals are sold at a reasonable price, for convenience, and to save money instead of cooking at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family.   Violito is friendly and is a good cook, which is why his food stall is popular in their area, with neighbors and the local working community as his regular customers.  He earns a minimum of 600 PHP net income a day.

To help him maintain his business, he is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, to buy additional raw ingredients such as pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for his cooking.  He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment, and the financial help that will be given him, for it will surely help cover their daily living expense, and for the school needs of his child.

Violito dreams to grow his business, to improve the quality of their lives, and secure the education of their child. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week; here he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients such as rice, meat, veggies, and condiments needed in his food business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 40-year-old married man with three children, two of whom attend school. He deals in a hides and skins business, mainly buying and selling hides and skins of cows. He started this business with a dream of developing himself as well as educating his children. He will use the loan money to buy more hides and skins to sell.

loans.use: to buy more hides and skins to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
