Josephine has been running a cafeteria in their village for five years. Her income has helped a lot to improve her business and repaid her previous loan which was successfully used for the business. She offers orders and catering services in their village to earn more income. 

Josephine took a new loan recently to purchase more ingredients and additional utensils for her cafeteria's expansion. She plans for business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and additional utensils for her cafeteria's expansion

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en: Dominica is aged 62, married to a company driver, and blessed with three children. She has sold "puto" and "kutsinta" (rice cakes) in their village for almost 15 years, and earns a net income of 5,000 PHP every month. Due to insufficient funds from her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP, to purchase sugar, special flour, margarine, evaporated milk, baking soda, and cheese for her food vending business. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, special flour, margarine, evaporated milk, baking soda, and cheese for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marygoret's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Marygoret, often described as an extremely resourceful person. She is 43 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Marygoret is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. This is why she decided to join in the first place. Marygoret says that she is happy to have made that decision, because since she first joined in 2014, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Marygoret will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of nine solar lights, as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est à son 4ème prêt et demande celui –ci pour renforcer et diversifier ses stocks de marchandise en achetant du sucre, de l’huile, du savon et du riz pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Odile a comme charges particulières ses besoins personnels car c’est son mari qui gère tous les charges quotidiennes de la famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle souhaite avoir d’autres boutiques d’alimentation pour augmenter ses revenus , épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile is a woman who is active in selling food products. She is married and a mother.

She is on her fourth loan and is requesting this one to strengthen and diversify her merchandise inventory by buying sugar, cooking oil, soap and rice to better satisfy her customers.

Odile must deal with her own personal needs as her husband manages all daily family expenditures. She starts her day at 8 am to finish at 6 pm.

She would like to operate other food stalls to increase her revenues, save money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy various fabrics, shoes, clutch bags and handbags for resale

loans.name: Eldy

texts.en:
Eldy is thankful that he was granted a 15,000 PHP loan that he faithfully repaid. The loan was used for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His tricycle earnings helped send his children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

He would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan, which he will use to pay for the continuous maintenance of his tricycle and to buy fertilizer for his small farm as well. It is very important that his tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service to his passengers. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given to him, for it will greatly help cover their daily needs. 

Eldy hopes to save enough to buy another tricycle in the near future. He aims to improve their house and wants to send his children to a good school. Every week he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit and to buy fertilizer for a productive harvest from his small farm.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 50-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Ruth has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Ruth described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Ruth’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
Milona is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy additional supplies and merchandise for her direct selling business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy more direct selling personal products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and beauty products of popular brands to meet the increased demand this Christmas season. She also works as an agent for appliances and furniture. She earns a minimum of PHP 25,000 a month. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. It will greatly help cover their daily living expense and support her children's education.

Milona hopes to grow her business and get more customers. She dreams of giving her children a good education and paying for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business

loans.name: Joebel

texts.en:
Joebel is a 46-year-old married man and a father of four grown children. Joebel lives with his family in Iloilo, Philippines. Joebel and his wife are engaged in a sewing business. Joebel also sells dried fish to the people in his neighborhood. These are the sources of their income.

Joebel is requesting a loan to buy more cloth, needles and thread for sewing and additional dried fish to sell. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

In the future, Joebel hopes to make his business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, needles and thread for sewing and additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vennie

texts.en: Vennie used the previous loan to buy human drugs for her clinic. Vennie is a 43-year-old widowed lady with two children, both at the university level. She is a farmer and a health servant. Vennie has a dream of educating her children and working hard to look after her family as a single mother. Vennie is faced with a challenge of defaulters after providing them with health services. Vennie wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo is 52 years old and a married rice farmer with five grown-up children who lives in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. So far she has been a farmer for over 15 years. Her husband is 52 years old and he is also a rice farmer. Four of her children are employed as beer promoters and a daughter works in a nearby country. Together, they can make approximately $27 a day. Now Keo would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for one of her children to commute to work. With this loan, her child will be able to reduce traveling expenses. In the future, she wants to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 9 farmers in Kakamega South District, in Kenya.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children.

Alice likes to think of herself as a very friendly person.  She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has earned more profit from each harvest.  Alice plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Alice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 30 years old, married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. Both of the children attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in electronics, mainly selling phones, cables, and wires among other items. He hopes to grow and expand his business to greater heights and educate his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more phones and cables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones and cables to sell.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito  has been selling snacks in the market for over eight years in order to earn a living.  His previous loan used for the purchase of ingredients has been repaid successfully. 

To make more snacks to sell, Juanito took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients and new utensils to use for his business.  He plans to use the additional revenue to purchase a stall in the market where he can sell snacks, as well as improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients and new utensils to use for his business.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group.  Margret is representing her group of 14 farmers in the Kakamega South District of Kenya, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Margret has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season.  Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be obtaining, as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.  With the profits from this coming season, Margret is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Margret's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Debaya Gnouma 14 Group

texts.fr: Alizata est veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Cette brave dame est la responsable de ce groupe de 5 membres et elle est dans le domaine de la restauration.Sa spécialité c'est du riz au gras bien fait. Alizata et les autres membres sont des femmes courageuses qui se battent au quotidien pour réussir dans leur commerce afin de garantir un bien-être à leur famille. Avec ce prêt, Alizata pourra acheter du riz et tous les ingrédients qu'il faut pour bien préparer pour sa clientèle.Les bénéfices de ce crédit permettront à cette dame de nourrir ses enfants, de les soigner en cas de maladie, de les habiller et de continuer sa restauration.
texts.en:
Alizata is the widowed mother of two children. This fine lady is in charge of this group of five members and is active in catering. Her specialty is 'riz au gras' (pilaf rice). Alizata and the other members are courageous women who fight daily to succeed in their businesses and ensure their families' well-being.

Alizata will use this loan to buy rice and all the necessary ingredients to prepare it for her customers. Profits from this loan will enable this lady to feed her children, clothe them, care for them in case of illness, and pursue her catering business.

loans.use: bolster her restaurant and buy prepared rice for resale

loans.name: Seraphine's Group

texts.en:
Seraphine is 26 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer.  She has 4 children and is married.  As a group leader, Seraphine is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Seraphine's desire to earn enough to send her children to school.  Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.  With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Seraphine and her group will receive a total of 6 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in Hoima, Uganda.  He is a 27-year-old married man with four children, with two attending school.  He runs a metal workshop, mainly welding doors and windows, among other items. 

Jackson earns additional income from operating a retail shop, and hopes to grow and expand his business to new areas to increase his profits. He will use the loan facility to buy a gas cylinder for welding purposes.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder for welding purposes.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is a 25-year-old single man. He lives with his parents in Imisli region. Azer is a hardworking man .He has a garden and he is raising vegetables. His mother is helping him in this business. His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN, but it is not enough to cover family demands.

Azer has asked for a loan from Aqroinvest CU for 1,200 AZN. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom and to improve access to water and sanitation for his parents. His family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but he is able to repay the loans he receives.

Azer is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom and to improve access to water and sanitation for their his parents

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Lenita is a native from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has two grown children. She earns a living by engaging in photo framing services. She designs frames for a particular photo and collects a certain fee. She has been operating this kind of business for 10 years now.

Lenita has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy materials like moldings, glass and mat board. This will help Lenita produce more photo frames that she could possibly finish and deliver on time, providing her customers with quality service and producing an excellent frame.

Lenita would like to expand her business to be successful and hopefully improve her livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials like moldings, glass and mat board

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 60 years old, married and has eight children.

Daniel likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Daniel plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Daniel’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Nefelonbert

texts.en:
Nefelonbert owns and operates a transportation service business. He has been doing this for over five years to earn a living, and he has supported the family's daily needs with this income.   

His previous loan, which was used to buy tires for his vehicle, was repaid successfully. 

Recently he has taken out a new loan to buy new tires, a motor cover and body parts for maintenance and safe transportation. 

He wants to renovate his house for safer and more comfortable living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a motor cover and body parts for maintenance and safe transportation

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 51-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor for fifteen years to help her husband to cover the increasing needs of their family. 

Houda works hard to provide her family with better living conditions. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house and make it a better place for her beloved children.

Houda hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own tailoring shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mounoucadi Iii Bis Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE est responsable du groupe MOUNOUCADI III BIS. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 va à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des prêts à porter depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, Lomé, Ghana  et en Turquis.
Elle veut s’acheter 15 ensembles tailleurs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Irene is the representative of the 'Mounoucadi III Bis' Group.  She is married and has three children.  The eldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 3 years old.  Two of her children currently attend school, and she is responsible for a total of 4 people.

Irene has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for 13 years.  She buys her supplies in Cotonou, Lomé, Ghana and Turquis.  Irene will buy 15 suits with her loan.  Her profits will be reinvested in the business to strengthen it.

In the future, Irene would like to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 15 ready-to-wear suits for resale.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: ADZO, âgée de 48 ans, est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui habite à Amadahomé situé au sud-est d’Adidogomé ; elle vend des friperies depuis 2007, qu’elle achète au marché d’ « Hezdranawè » par faute de moyen une fois par mois. ADZO, ayant le souci de répondre aux besoins de ses clients, sollicite ce crédit pour mieux approvisionner afin de gagner plus pour supporter les dépenses des foyers et surtout se soigner au moment opportun et bien se nourrir.
texts.en:
Adzo is 48 years old, married and has four children.  They live in Amadahomé which is situated to the south-east of Adidogomé.  She has been selling second-hand clothing since 2007.

Through lack of funds, Adzo buys her clothing stock, once a month from the market in Hezdranawè.  She would like to be able to offer her clients more, so she has requested this loan in order to be able to buy more stock.  This would allow her to contribute more to the running expenses of her household, provide healthcare when it is needed and improve the quality of the food she can afford.

loans.use: to buy 100 items of clothing and a bale of sheets for resale.

loans.name: Jessenia Jisselldy

texts.es:
Jessenia  Guisselldy tiene 41 años de edad, es Lic. Admón. de Empresas, es madre soltera de dos hijos que estudian la primaria y están a cargo de ella, el papá de los niños le ayuda con la pensión alimenticia, ella es muy trabajadora y su mayor propósito es que a sus hijos no les falte nada, por eso desde que se separó de su ex esposo se ha dedicado a trabajar para mejorar su calidad de vida,  ella además de ser asalariada desempeñando el cargo de atención al Cliente para la Empresa Enitel en Nueva Guinea con medio tiempo; en tiempos libre atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de Celulares en su vivienda y cuando ella sale al trabajo es atendido por su sobrina que habita con ella y está a su cargo, poco a poco con su salario y créditos que ha recibido de Afodenic pudo comprar pequeñas cantidades de celulares para comercializarlos y ahora su clientela ha crecido sus clientes piden mayor oferta y con las ganancias no es suficiente para dar abasto.

Solicita este crédito  a Kiva para poder dar cobertura, ella necesita comprar diferentes marcas de celulares tales como Nokia, LG, Very Kool, Wawei, Motorola, HTC y otras marcas solicitadas que solo con este crédito podría lograr su proyecto.

Su mayor meta es ver a sus pequeños todos unos profesionales, sacarlos adelante, para ello es importante continuar aumentando su negocio y contar con ingresos fijos, pretende continuar trabajando con créditos para expandir su negocio si es posible establecerlo en otro punto con mayor espacio y mejorar la atención a sus clientes y su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Jessenia is 41 years old. She has her degree in business administration and is a single mother raising two children who are in elementary school. The father of her children helps her with childcare payments, though Jessenia is a very hard worker and her greatest purpose is to ensure that her children want for nothing. So, ever since she separated from her ex husband, she has been working to improve her quality of life. She is also a salaried employee working part-time in client services for the company Enitel in New Guinea.

In her free time she looks after her own small business, selling cell phones out of her home. When she goes out, the business is run by her niece, who lives with her and is also her dependent. Bit-by-bit, with her salary and with loans she has received from Afodenic, Jessenia was able to purchase small quantities of cell phones to sell. Now her customer base has grown and they are looking for a greater variety, but with her earnings Jessenia doesn't have enough to grow her stock. 

She requests this loan from Kiva to cover her, as she needs to purchase various brands of cell phone such as Nokia, LG, Very Kool, Wawei, Motorola, HTC and others that have been requested. She can complete this project with the loan requested.

Jessenia's greatest goal is to see her children grow into professionals, to get them ahead. For this, it is important to continue growing her business and to earn a fixed income. She plans to continue working through loans to expand her business and, if possible, to establish it in another place with more space. This would improve her service to her customers as well as her household income.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones for her business.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, mantiene clientes satisfechos con la venta de antojitos y productos de revista, con la inversión anterior mejoró su inventario obteniendo así mejores ingresos con los que da a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
Está solicitando más capital para comprar aceite, yuca, plátanos, papas, repollo, etc., para seguir elaborando los antojitos y manteniendo su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: María has many satisfied customers who purchase snacks and magazines from her. With her last loan, she increased her inventory and obtained greater earnings, with which she has given her family a more comfortable lifestyle. She is requesting more capital to purchase oil, yucca, plantains, potatoes, cabbage, etc. to continue preparing snacks and to maintain her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase oil, yucca, plantains, potatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Femme divorcée et âgée de 35 ans, MANA est mère de deux enfants vivant tous à Zanguéra ; elle est revendeuse des produits plastiques et des chaussures depuis 2005 puis s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour arriver à garder sa clientèle si énorme, elle devient démarcheuse car elle se voit obliger de recourir vers ses concurrentes du marché pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour cela, MANA demande un crédit pour pallier à cette situation qui ne lui est pas rentable et par conséquent pourra le servir pour augmenter et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Mana is a 35-year-old, divorced woman with two children.  They all live in Zanguéra.  She has been selling plastic products and shoes since 2005, and she buys her supplies once a month from the main market in Lomé.

Mana has an extensive customer base and there is a lot of demand for her products.  She sometimes, therefore, has to buy products from her competitors so she can satisfy this demand.  This is not a profitable solution for her, so she has requested this loan in order to increase and extend the range of goods that she offers and avoid having to do this.

loans.use: to buy 10 plates, 10 dozen cold boxes and 3 dozen pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Yere Madjigui Group

texts.fr: Agathe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont encore scolarisés.Son époux fait de la maçonnerie. Elle est responsable de ce groupe qui est client de ACFIME depuis Juillet 2008. Ce groupe fait parti des bons clients de l'institution dans la mesure ou il fait des remboursements à la bonne date. Agathe a besoin de ce prêt pour payer un chargement(un camion rempli de bois) et demi de bois pour vendre. Agathe arrive déjà avec son commerce a aider sa famille donc les bénéfices de ses ventes lui permettront de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Agathe is married to a stone mason, and has four children.  Three of her children still attend school.  She is the representative of this group who have been clients of the field partner, ACFIME, since July 2008.  The group are good clients because they always make their repayments on time.

Agathe has requested this loan in order to be able to pay for one-and-a-half truckloads of wood which she will sell.  She is already able to provide for the needs of her family so the profits she makes will be reinvested in her business to strengthen it.

loans.use: to buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Touwendé 2 Group

texts.fr: Nana membre représentatif du groupe est un femme battante mère de 6 enfants dont 3 sont encore scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce des céréales. elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter des céréales (maïs, sorgho,..) stocker pour vendre en détail à ses clients. Avec le bénéfice, elle aidera son époux qui est chauffeur à s'occuper de leur famille et à continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Nana, the featured member of the group, is a spirited mother of six children, three of whom are still in school.

She trades grain cereals, and needs the loan to buy cereals (maize, sorghum, ..), and store them for retail sales to customers.

The profits will enable her to help her husband, who is a driver, in taking care of their family and pursue her business.

loans.use: buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay laborers for field work

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA ES HABITANTE DE CHINANDEGA CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE EMBASES PLASTICOS Y SACOS VACIOS DESDE VARIOS AÑOS ELLA ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA EMPRENDEDORA QUE TRABAJA DE LUNES A DOMINGO DE LAS 7 m a 5 pm LA SEÑORA SE EFUERZA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA ELLA SOLICITA EL FINANCIAMIENTO CADA 2 MESES PARA LA COMPRA DE SU PRODUCTO COMO SON BARRILES DE PLASTICOS BACIOS , BOTELLAS, SACOS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en: María lives in Chinandega and has had a business selling plastic goods and empty bags for a number of years. María is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She works seven-days-a-week from 7am to 5pm. María works hard in order to help her family to get ahead. She is applying for a loan every two months in order to buy barrels, containers, empty sacks and other products to sell.

loans.use: to buy barrels, containers, and empty sacks to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Inspiracion De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Inspiración de Santiago, representado por doña Mirna, casada y tiene un hijo quien estudia la primaria, su esposo es chofer de una empacadora de Santiago, doña Mirna se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en el mercado municipal de Santiago sac desde hace tres años, desea ampliar su mercadería y por la temporada que se acerca tiene que tener variedad a sus clientes, desea poder darle a su hijo una casa donde vivir y darle estudio y una carrera que el desee , su compañera Claudia Elizabeth también tiene su puesto en el mercado también de ropa típica desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The "Inspiración de Santiago" duo is represented by Mirna. She is married and has one son who is in primary school. Mirna's husband is a driver for a packing business in Santiago. Mirna herself has been making a living selling typical clothing at the municipal market in Santiago for three years. She wants to increase her merchandise on offer; she needs to have a variety of items to offer her customers for the approaching holiday season.  Mirna wants to offer her son a house where he can live and give him an education, including a university education.

Mirna's colleague, Claudia Elizabeth, also has a stall in the market where she has been selling typical clothing for two years.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alicia, está muy agradecida por el apoyo que la institución y los inversionistas kiva la han brindado a tevés del financiamiento anterior, pues hoy cuenta con un negocio más competitivo y un mejor estilo de vida.
Como se acerca la temporada de fin de año ella está solicitando  un nuevo crédito para comprar papelería, alambre, espelma y flores naturales, para elaborar flores artificiales y tener un inventario más surtido para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is very grateful for the support she received from the institution and Kiva lenders through her previous loan.  Now her business is more competitive and she leads a better lifestyle.

As the year-end holiday season is approaching she is requesting a new loan to buy paper, wire, candle wax and natural flowers to make artificial flowers and have more stock on hand to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy paper, wire, candle wax and natural flowers to make artificial flowers.

loans.name: Esmaragdo

texts.es:
El señor Esmaragdo es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.

 Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.
texts.en:
Esmaragdo is an experienced cabinetmaker who learned the trade many years ago thanks to having worked in many carpentry shops.  Over time he became independent and established his own workshop.  Despite the adversities he has been able to provide for his family and get ahead.

His greatest pride is to have built a very good reputation and prestige thanks to his good work.  He makes furniture with his own hands and almost everything in his humble home was made by him.

The loan he is requesting is to buy wood so he can make more furniture and earn a good profit.  His main goal is focused on his children as he wants to give them a very good education so they can be successful people in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo a quien le garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañero, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace más de unos meses comenzó inicio con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Ana busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Ana tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her common-law husband and a son for whom she guarantees a quality lifestyle thanks to her business.  She tries to generate an income and contribute economically, together with her husband, to the household to improve living conditions.

Several months ago she started her own stationery and variety goods business with much effort.  Her shop is located in the town of El Carmen del Viboral.

Since the number of customers is increasing and there is a rise in demand for her products, Ana is seeking a loan to buy stationery goods so she can offer a wider range of products.  Through this loan Ana's business will receive a boost and her inventory and sales will improve.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Fucion Group

texts.es: Dúo Fusión, como representante la señora Irma soltera, se dedica a la venta de gas propano desde hace tres años, empezó con unos cuantos cilindros hoy en día ya maneja una cantidad mayor para la venta,y ha comprado su propios cilindros, ya tienen un local mas y un ingreso mas ahora desea ampliar su local y comprar una moto para poder repartir y darle empleo a su hermano, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de gas propano
texts.en: The representative of the group, Irma, is single and has been in the propane gas selling business for three years.  She started out with only a few tanks but now manages a greaster sales volume.  She has purchased her own tanks and has another sales location and more income.  Now she wants to expand the business and buy a motorcycle for deliveries and to give her brother work.  The loan she is requesting is to buy propane gas.

loans.use: To buy propane gas.

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Jenny tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus recetas.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con una mejor materia prima.
texts.en:
Jenny has vast experience in the bakery business.  Some time ago she established her own bakery which has given her good results to date.  She always has preferred to work independently, which she does seven hours a day, every day.

She currently needs to buy supplies and ingredients to make her products.  Her greatest dream is to have a large bakery to supply different stores.

With this help she will be able to work in a more organized fashion with better raw materials.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients to make her products.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh  is a hardworking woman, 48 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and  her husband is a woodworker. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly. In this picture, she stands beside her house with her small child.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a widow and she lives in Pines, Oroquieta. To earn a living, Gloria manages her rice farm and is also engaged in a hog-raising business. Gloria mastered doing this type of activity over twenty years. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in July 2012. She is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals to sustain her needs of alleviating poverty. Gloria requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields on her rice farm, and also to buy additional piglets, animal feed and vitamins. This will greatly help her boost her income. Someday, she hopes to buy an area of rice land to expand her farm and venture into the rice retailing business. Gloria is now supporting her granddaughter in her college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, additional piglets, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel lives in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a milling machine that he uses to mill maize and millet, among other items. He earns additional incomes from growing rice and maize. He hopes to diversify and grow his business so as to improve his standards of living even though he faces seasonal difficulties where turn up of customers is very low during the rainy seasons. He is requesting a loan to buy a new milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a new milling machine.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina has been helping her husband in working their own farm to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she had used to cover replanting costs. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the financial needs of the entire farm. So she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm to have a more productive harvest. She hopes to gain more income from her farm after she has invested this capital to improve it.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia, a sus 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años. Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una prima que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por 4 años. 

Hace aproximadamente 2 años, Claudia se independizó y montó su taller en sociedad, pero poco tiempo después su hermano se retiró del negocio porque las ventas eran muy bajas; sin embargo, ella, por necesidad y con mucha fe, continuo con el taller, con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros y ahora le brinda empleo directo a una persona y 2 más, indirectos. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una máquina recubridora, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una marca propia y una línea de ropa interior y blusas para dama, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Además, podrá ofrecer un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia y una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 34 years of age and lives with her husband and 2-year-old child. She began to work in the area of the clothes-making when she was 16. She worked with her cousin who had a large company where she was in charge of furbishing and inspecting the clothes. After she turned 18 she remained linked to the company where she worked for another 4 years. 

About 2 years ago Claudia started her own studio in her community, but shortly thereafter her brother left the business because of low sales. Nevertheless, with a lot of faith and determination, she continued with her workshop hoping that sales would increase and that's what happened. She began to secure third party contracts and now has one full-time employee as well as 2 part-time employees. With this income she has been able to provide for her family. 

With the loan she is requesting she hopes to purchase a sowing machine for cover-stitching she she'll be able to produce finely developed clothing with excellent detailing for her customers. This will increase her contracts and could generate greater earnings so that she might realize her dream of having her own brand and line of undergarments and blouses for women, in addition to providing employment opportunities for others. Furthermore, she could improve the quality of life of her family and provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: purchase a sowing machine (for cover-stitching) for her studio.

loans.name: Hushnuda

texts.ru: Хушнуда талантливая трудолюбивая женщина с города Конибодом. Ей 27 лет. Она разведена и живет у матери. Хушнуда обладает мастерством вышивки. Вот уже два года как она предоставляет свои услуги по вышивке женских платьев и халатов. У нее много клиентов, так как ее работа качественная и вышивки, сделанные ею выходят красиво и оригинально. Хушнуда по заказу клиенток украшает их платья с помощью золотистых ниток, стразов и сваровских камней. Сегодня в Таджикистане такой вид услуг очень востребован и платья с вышивками считаются модными. В связи с этим Хушнуда хотела бы расширить свою деятельность. На сумму от кредита она собирается купить вышивальную машинку, стразы и золотистые нитки для вышивки. Хушнуда надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Hushnuda is a talented and hardworking woman from the city of Konibodom.  She is 27 years old, divorced, and living with her mother.  Hushnuda is a skilled embroiderer.  For the past two years already, she has been providing her services and embroidering women's dresses and gowns.  She has many customers because her work is of high quality and the embroidery designs she produces are both beautiful and original.  She works from orders and adorns her customers' dresses with golden threads, sequins and rhinestones.  This type of service is very popular nowadays in Tajikistan, as embroidered dresses are very fashionable.  For this reason, Hushnuda would like to expand her activity.  She is planning to use her loan to buy an embroidery machine, some sequins and golden thread for embroidery.  She is hoping to receive financial support.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine, some sequins and golden thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik just finished her first Kiva loan cycle for which she thanks both Kiva lenders and its field partner, Nor Horizon. She says she will be very happy if Kiva lenders support her for the second time. Sofik and her husband live with their son’s family. She is still active in her farming and agricultural occupations. On her plot of land with the help of her husband, she cultivates cabbages, greens and potatoes for sale and for her family's use. Her cattle (cows and calves) also give farm products for sale, which are milk and meat. Sofik says that she is happy that despite of her age, she manages to do the main work of her farm with limited help from her family members. She hopes in future to increase the number of cattle that she farms.

This Kiva loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams she will use for the purchase of one more cow and also animal fodder, in order to avoid the lack of it during winter.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and animal fodder for the winter

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday, aged 27, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and thus charged with the responsibility of taking care of his two children, one of whom attends school. 

Sunday operates a retail shop which mainly sells cooking oil, sugar and salt among many other items. He desires to expand and develop his business and also to educate his children but faces the challenge of price fluctuations. Sunday intends to use the loan to buy more soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap to sell.

loans.name: Rina Ester

texts.es: Rina de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos asi como muestra en la fotografía,  su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ingredientes como arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Rina, 41 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She is dedicated to making food as is shown in the photograph. Her business is located in her place of residence. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and the friendliness she shows when she's selling. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc to be able to continue her work which generates good income.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Santiago Isaac

texts.es:
Santiago desde hace 12 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de café y col.

Es una actividad aprendida por herencia de su familia y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la vida por las oportunidades que le brinda.

El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.

El cultivo de Santiago Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
For 12 years, Santiago has been dedicated to agricultural production and he gets up early every day to work and tend to his land where he has crops of mainly coffee and cabbage.

It is work learned from his family and gradually he has been perfecting his techniques and skills in this field.

Today, he feels proud of what he has been able to build with his effort and he feels very thankful in life for the opportunities afforded to him.

He is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides so he can keep his land in optimal conditions for the crops.

His greatest dream is to have his own house and there be able to enjoy his old age alongside his wife.

Santiago's crops will be able to keep going and progress with your help!

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides so he can keep his land in optimal conditions for his crops.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a hard-working mother from Oroquieta City. She owns and manages a business in which she operates a coconut meat milling service. She only accepts shelled coconuts for the service that she provides. 

Guillerma has signed up as a member with the cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to insurances and financial assistance. She has now applied for a loan to buy additional materials and equipment to improve her business and to be able to cater to more customers. Guillerma hopes to succeed in this business so she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and equipment for her coconut meat milling service

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is managing her rice farm from which she earns a meagre income which primarily supports her family. At present, she is receiving a monthly pension from an insurance company which is greatly helping her in pursuing her goals. 

Cristina hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing through the support of her loan of PHP 45,000. The loan is intended to purchase construction materials for the  repair of her house. 

Cristina hopes to maintain her membership of PMPC in good standing with a good repayment record. She is very thankful that all her financing needs are being supported by PMPC. Some day, Cristina deeply wishes to live a happy, healthy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the repair of her house

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar artículos de revista, ropa usada, bebidas, golosinas, etc., para que su negocio siga funcionando y generándole ganancias con las que cancela los gastos familiares y su deuda.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo adquirir más productos para que sus clientes estén satisfechos, su situación financiera ha cambiado positivamente  y su familia se mantiene brindando apoyo para continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting another loan to buy catalog products, used clothing, drinks, candies, etc. so that her business keeps functioning and generating income with which she can pay her family expenses and her debt.

With the previous loan she was able to acquire more products so that her customers remained satisfied. Her financial situation has changed positively and her family keeps providing support so she can continue to progress.

loans.use: to buy catalog products, used clothing, drinks, candies, etc. so her business keeps functioning and generating income.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Esteban de 44 años de edad unido, el motivo por el cual el está impulsado en realizar otro préstamo es para una nueva inversión el cultivo de cebollas.

Los préstamos eran con otras instituciones, pero no contaban con los beneficios que nos da adicla, como lo es la forma de pago, intereses mensuales y el capital al vencimiento pues son beneficios que nos ayudan a soñar en un futuro mejor para nuestros futuros hijos.

El uso respectivo que dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de Cebolla y abonos orgánicos e químicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrido con Esteban que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.

Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para sus hijos para que se convierta en profesional en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
To work the land under a grueling sun though always willing to sweat to provide a better future for his children is the reason why Esteban, 44,  is driven to take another loan for a new investment in an onion crop.

The loans were with other institutions and they lacked the benefits that ADICLA provides such as the form of payment, monthly interest and principal at maturity as they are the benefits that help us dream of a better future for our future children.

The respective use of the second loan is to buy onion seed and organic and chemical fertilizers to be able to start to grow more products to then sell in the community market and thus obtain income to support the family and so that they have adequate living conditions.

The change that a loan makes is mainly to assure the harvest with the resources and overall handling of the crops so that people obtain better quality products and this is what has happened to Esteban through the loans granted: he has been able to have better harvests.

One of his goals is to build houses for his children so they can have adequate living conditions and education for his children so that they can become professionals and to keep harvesting fertile lands in his community.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Beatrice is representing her group of eleven farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Beatrice has been a farmer for more than twenty years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Beatrice is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Beatrice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of eight solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory wholesale, such as blouses, jeans, women's pants, and more.

loans.name: Ernesto Hernein

texts.es: Ernesto de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su microbús desde hace varios años y tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, adicional a eso también tiene una tienda, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas nuevas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 48, lives with his wife and three children in a house of their own. He has been driving a minibus for some years now and has many clients because he drives carefully. He also owns a store.

Ernesto is requesting a loan to buy new tires and for the maintenance of his vehicle, which is his main source of income. This will result in a better income.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena, casada y tiene una hija que estudia ya básicos, y su esposo se dedica al comercio desde hace 18 años, doña Elena tiene una tienda de consumo diario, como arroz, fijol, maíz, pollo, vegetales, pastas y golocinas desde hace 19 años, en un local que era de su mama y ella eredo, esta ubicado en la casa de habitación de la misma, feliz por la fidelidad de sus clientes solo espera poder seguir sirviendo igual que hasta ahora, su sueño ayudar a su esposo a llevar el sustento al hogar y darle a su única hija lo mejor y un patrimonio. También ayudar a su mama,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de producto comestibles para la venta
texts.en: Maria Elena is married and has a daughter who is in high school already. Her husband has worked as a merchant for 18 years. Elena has had a store for daily consumption products such as rice, beans, corn, chicken, vegetables, pasta and snacks for 19 years. It is in a locale that was her mother's and that she inherited. It's located in her house. She is happy with her customers' loyalty and she only hopes to be able to keep serving them like she has done so far. Her dream is to help her husband support the home and give her only daughter the best and leave her an inheritance. She also wants to help her mother. She is asking for this loan to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime to make tortillas.

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.es:
Ernesto de 52 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 3 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende en compañía de su esposa. 

Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Ernesto, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio. 

Sueña con mejorar la condición de su vivienda y dejar un legado a sus hijos.

El negocio de Ernesto Necesita tu ayuda para salir adelante y progresar!
texts.en:
Ernesto is 52 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has 3 children. For 3 years, he has had a general store that he runs with his wife. His dream is to expand his store, where he distributes items such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products and more.   
 
Right now, he has little inventory and this is bad for him since he can't supply the products that his customers ask him for. Because of this, 
Ernesto decided to ask for a loan in order to get more organized and buy the necessary inventory wholesale, such as grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products to increase his selection and be able to offer better service to people. This will also be an increase in his income to cover the basic needs of the entire business. 

He dreams of improving the condition of his home and leaving his children a legacy. 

Ernesto's business needs your help to get ahead and progress!

loans.use: to buy necessary inventory wholesale, such as grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products, to increase his selection.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 100 chicks, then raise them for resale

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Orlando es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Bello con su esposa y sus dos hijos que tiene en la universidad.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de bebidas tipo bolis. 

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estas bebidas. El ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 

Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.

El solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido de bebidas en bolis al por mayor.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando is a veteran of a thousand battles during his life. He lives in the town of Bello with his wife and two children who are in college. He is a very hardworking man who for some time has been working in the business of selling ice pop beverages. 
 
His business is buying and selling these beverages. He offers his products as a street vendor and when a customer orders something from him, he tries to meet the need completely. He says that it is a simple business to do at his age. He is asking for a loan to buy ice pop beverage inventory wholesale. 

The loan will give him the opportunity to capitalize his business and give a considerable boost to his activity, allowing him to obtain resources for his children's college education.

loans.use: to buy a selection of ice pop beverages wholesale.

loans.name: Zekoura Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIE PAULINE  est responsable du groupe ZEKOURA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 26ans. 01va à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend du bois de chauffe  depuis plus de 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés d’à coté.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 camion de 10tonnes de bois de chauffe.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne assurer l’avenir des enfants en leur payant des parcelles.
texts.en:
Marie Pauline is the group representative for the Zekoura Group. She is a married mother to five children. Her eldest is 36 years old and her youngest is 26 years old. One of her children is currently attending an educational establishment. She also has two dependants living within her care.
Marie Pauline has been selling firewood for over five years. She gets her supplies from the local markets. She plans on purchasing a 10-tonne truckload of firewood. With the profits from this venture, she would like to expand her business. She hopes to be able to give her children a better future by buying them plots of land.

loans.use: to purchase a 10-tonne truckload of firewood

loans.name: Soutien Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOU  est responsable du groupe SOUTIEN. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 08mois. 02 va à l’école. 
Mme fait la coiffure  depuis  08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 30paquets de mèches et 01 dizaine de pommade.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut ouvrir une boutique. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs Mamou is responsible for the SOUTIEN group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 12 and the youngest is 8 months old. Two of her children attend school. She has been a hairstylist for 8 years. She stocks up in the surrounding markets. She hopes to use this loan to purchase 30 packs of hair extensions and a dozen packs of hair gel. She hopes to use her profits to open a small shop, and to cover the education fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase 30 packs of hair extensions and a dozen packs of hair gel

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 62-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Paul has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Paul described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Paul’s group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Betreace's Group

texts.en:
Betreace, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Betreace is representing her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Betreace has been a farmer for one year and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Betreace is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6.75 acres will be planted by Betreace's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 38 and married in Oroquieta, she runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of her family. Everyday she patiently tends her store until in the evening. Jill wants to expand her business. She recently signed up for membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance. Now, she has borrowed a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, Jill dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Salam 2 Group

texts.fr: Maymouna,membre représentatif, est marié, mère d'un enfant. Elle et les autres membres sont des femmes battantes qui travaillent avec ACFIME depuis Août 2011 et jusqu'ici elles font des remboursements sans difficultés. Avec ce prêt, Maymouna compte acheter des pagnes pour profiter des fêtes de fin d'année pour vendre. Le bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et d'aider son époux dans les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en: Maymouna, a representative of the ACFIME group, is married and the mother of one child. She and the other members are all strong women who have worked with ACFIME since August 2011, having to date successfully reimbursed their loans without any difficulties. With this loan Maymouna plans to purchase traditional "pagne" fabric to sell during the end of the year holiday season. Profits will allow her to continue her business activity and to support her husband in taking care of household expenses.

loans.use: purchase traditional "pagne" fabric to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Rosa, 53, lives in her own home with her family.  For several years, she has been engaged in selling clothing and, with her sales, she manages to get ahead.  She wishes to improve her home by building a room in the area shown in the photo.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, cement, and iron, and to pay labor costs so that she and her family can live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and iron, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, she is representing her group in Kakamega South District, formed by 11 farmers, including herself.

Nancy has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2012 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Not only will she get maize seeds and fertilizer with her loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. She decided that she will use the profits she gains from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

With this loan, Nancy’s Group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dúo Maria De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Maria de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es doña Francisca quien desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de ropa típica nueva y usada, como cortes, blusas, delantales, suéteres, güipiles.  Siendo vendedora ambulante su sueño es algún día tener un local propio en el mercado del pueblo.  Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y siendo viuda cada mañana le llena de alegría ir, vender y visitar a sus clientes.  Las fiestas navideñas se acercan en el pueblo y las muchachas ya empezaron a pedir güipiles, cortes, blusas, suéteres pero el dinero que ella tiene no le es suficiente y necesita solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar la ropa que le falta y no quedarles mal a sus compradoras.
texts.en:
Francisca is the person in charge of the "Dúo Maria de San Pedro" group. She has been selling new and used traditional clothing for 25 years like skirts, blouses, aprons, sweaters, guiplies (a traditional blouse) She is an itinerant vendor and her dream is to one day have her own stall in the community's market. She has the support of her children being a widow.

Every morning she is filled with joy to go out to sell and visit her clients. The Christmas festivities are coming to the community and the girls are already starting to request guipiles, skirts, blouses, sweaters. But she does not have enough money and needs to ask for a loan to be able to buy the clothing that she doesn't have and not disappoint her buyers.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Salome, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Salome joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Salome plans to buy more land to cultivate in.

Between the 15 farmers in Salome's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en una zona muy transitada tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como: frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, harina de arroz, etc. y así tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca is 62 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her two children, She works selling pupusas. Her business is located in her house in a busy area. She has lots of clients because of her good prices. She is requesting a loan to buy raw material like beans, cheese, pork crackings, corn, rice flour, etc. so she can have more income and a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, cheese, pork cracklings, corn, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a single mom who has been farming for many years and she earns a better income from this.

She had repaid successfully her previous loan and is now taking a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to have a productive farm. She is now happy to say that she was assured a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a productive farm

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Bernardo Jose

texts.es:
Bernardo, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Sincelejo, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Bernardo solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos de aproximadamente 70 kilos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante.
texts.en: Bernardo is a farmer full of dreams and hopes in his life. He wants to get his family ahead by the sweat on his brow. So he starts with his business raising pigs, which is a common profession in the municipality of Sincelejo where not only the prices but the quality of the pigs raised here stand out. Bernardo is requesting a loan to buy pigs of about 70 kg which he will fatten and later sell. His only objective is to progress and care for his family which is what lifts his fighting and vigorous spirit.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Noe De Jesus

texts.es:
Noé ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes en el municipio de Medellín.

Es un padre amoroso y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.

El siempre fue muy inquieto y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.

Hoy en día es un hombre amable y muy emprendedor, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

El solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco y con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Noé has been able to accumulate great positive experiences in his life. One of them is to have been able to work in different grocery stores in the municipality of Medellin.

He is a loving and responsible father who keeps his family in mind during his work day. He has always been active and has a great capacity for service qualities which motivated him to open his own grocery store which has become well known in his sector.

Today he is a likable and enterprising person always looking for alternatives to make his clients feel well looked after and buy quality products. He is requesting financial assistance to get a loan and buy an assortment of basic food items as he plans to increase the products he offers.

He wants to have a much bigger inventory so he can have the products available for his clients. His big dream is to be a large food distributor. He thinks that little by little with the help of the Interactuar Corporation he can achieve this.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of basic food products.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 37 years old, is married and has 4 children. Mary has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Félix de 61 años de edad casado, el motivo por el cual el está impulsado en realizar otro préstamo es para una nueva inversión el cultivo de papas y repollo.

Los préstamos eran con otras instituciones, pero no contaban con los beneficios que nos da adicla, como lo es la forma de pago, intereses mensuales y el capital al vencimiento pues son beneficios que nos ayudan a soñar en un futuro mejor para nuestros futuros hijos.

El uso respectivo que dará el segundo crédito es para la compra de semillas de papas, repollos, abonos orgánicos e químicos para poder empezar a cultivar más productos para luego venderlas en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener una ganancias para el sustento de su familia y para que tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada. 

El cambio que realiza un crédito es principalmente asegurar  la cosecha con los insumos y el manejo en general de las cosechas agrícolas, para que las personas obtengan productos de la mejora calidad y es lo que a ocurrido con Félix que por medio de los prestamos que se les a concedido el a podido obtener mejores cosechas.
