Una de las metas de el es la construcción de casas para sus hijos para una condición de vida adecuada y estudios para sus hijos para que se convierta en profesional en la vida y seguir cosechando las tierras fértiles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
To work the land under a relentless sun, ready to sweat the whole time to provide a better future for his children. Félix is 61 years old and married.

The reason he is motivated to get another loan is to make an new investment in his potato and cabbage crops. He has had loans from other institutions but they have not provided him the benefits that Adicla does, such as the method of payment, monthly interest and the capital. At maturity they are benefits that make us dream of a better future for our children.

He will use this second loan to buy potato seeds, cabbage, organic manure and chemicals to be able to grow more products to sell later in the market in his community, thus making a profit for the sustenance of his family so that they have proper living conditions.

The difference that a loan makes is mainly to secure the harvest with the inputs and the general maintenance of the agricultural crops. Then people can obtain the best quality products. This is what happened to Félix through the loans that he has been given. He has had better harvests.

One of his goals is to construct houses for his children so that they have adequate living conditions and the education to become professionals in their lives. He will continue to harvest the fertile lands of his community.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, cabbage, organic manure and chemicals.

loans.name: Dúo Azucena De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Azucena de San Pedro La encargada de este dúo es la señora Blanca quien tiene una venta de frutas como papaya, sandia, plátano, coco,  melón, naranja, manzana nacionales y exportadas.   Las buenas fechas se acercan y necesita comprar más fruta porque la que tiene no le alcanza, al comprar por docena le sale más barata y quiere aprovechar los pedidos que le han hecho.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, aunque aun están pequeños.  Su sueño es tener un hermoso puesto de frutas vendiendo de todo y dar muy buenos precios.  Hay varios pedidos que le han hecho pero el dinero que tiene para comprar la fruta por docena no le alcanza y por eso necesita un préstamo para surtir el negocio con todo tipo de fruta.
texts.en:
Blanca is in charge of Dúo Azucena de San Pedro.  She sells national and exported fruits such as papaya, watermelon, bananas, coconut, cantaloupe, oranges, and apples.  Good times are approaching and she needs to buy more fruit because she doesn't have enough.  It's cheaper by the dozen, and she wants to make the most of her orders.

Blanca has several orders, but not the money to buy the fruit by the dozen, so she needs a loan to stock her business with all types of fruit.

She has the support of her husband and, although they're still young, her children.  Her dream is to have a nice fruit stand, sell everything, and offer very good prices.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, iron, cement, quarried stone, a toilet, and to pay for labor to construct a sewer and install a toilet.  Her latrine is in bad shape, and she needs to give her family better hygiene and safety.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a hardworking mother from Aloran. She is 61 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Isabel has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Isabel hopes to succeed in this business to continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Maria Janet

texts.es:
Maria es madre hijo de 8 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 11 meses se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada de fin de año; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Maria, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria has an 8-year-old son. She has been working as an independent saleswoman for eleven months, something she learned empirically, when she realized she needed to generate resources in order to sustain her family. She sells all kinds of products, such as clothes, perfumes, body lotions, and accessories. An advantage that this activity has is that she meets new people every day, to which she offers her products. This results in more sales every day.

She is requesting a loan that will help her to buy products in bulk, such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes. She will be able to increase her stock levels, offer a wider variety and fulfill her customers’ demands, which increase during this time of the year. This will result in a higher income for her.

Maria is hardworking and persistent. She wants to continue working in order to get ahead with her business. In the near future, she would like to open a store in a commercial area where she can offer even more products. This would result in better profits and a more stable financial situation, which would help her to offer her son an excellent education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk, such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes.

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en:
Ceyhun is a 31-year–old married man with 3 children. He and his wife have grown fruit and vegetables for 7  years. Growing seasonal fruit is very common in Azerbaijan because there is a high demand for fresh fruit which are used  to make juice, jam, pies, and cocktails. People visit their grocery because the fruit is always fresh and tasty. 

He earns 200 AZN from gardening, which is the only source of income. Ceyhun has a problem with water and applied for a 1,200 AZN to repair his  water pipes to be able to water his garden properly.

loans.use: to repair his  water pipes.

loans.name: Ramer

texts.en:
Ramer has owned and operated a transportation service  for over five years to earn a living. He  supports the family's daily needs with this income .   

He used a previous loan to successfully repair his vehicle. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase a motor sidecar for his transportation services business. 

He wants to renovate his house to provide a safe and comfortable living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motor sidecar for his transportation business.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 37 years old and married with three children, all attend school.

She has raised pigs for 7 years and requests 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She earns additional income from charcoal retailing and food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is engaged in a retail business. She trades in perfumes and cosmetics in Kapan town, where she lives with her husband and 1-year-old child. 

Sona receives orders from her customers (who are mostly her neighbors) and acquires the stock of perfume and cosmetics from Yerevan town. To be able to enlarge the selling products and offer a large variety of cosmetics to her customers, Sona has applied for this loan. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of perfumes and cosmetics for reselling to customers

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 43 years old and married with two children, who are both in school. Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.  In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anjelin's Group

texts.en:
Anjeline is a 50-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader who is described as being a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Anjeline  has been able to consistently feed her family.

Anjeline described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited about purchasing a solar light, fertilizer, and maize, because she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Anjeline’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Leidy Natalia

texts.es:
Leidy en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de La Amaga, con el cual planea pagar sus estudios y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar en el que vive con su esposo.

Para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprar su propia vivienda y poder vivir de una manera tranquila con su familia.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una joven Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Leidy, in her search for a promising future and some good opportunities for getting ahead, decided to start a business that she thinks will give her everything she has always dreamed of.

She's going to set up a grocery store business in her home in the town of La Amaga.  She plans to pay for her education and help with expenses in the home she shares with her husband.

For that Leidy needs the help of a loan to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a supply of basic staple products to stock and start up her business.

Her biggest dream is to be able to buy her own home and live peacefully with her family.  Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a young Colombian with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a supply of basic staple products to stock and start up her business

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice has 5 children and is described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Beatrice represents a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Beatrice has been a farmer for more than 20 years. She wanted to access quality training and acquire new farming methods and decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will purchase  farming supplies and a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Beatrice is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Beatrice's Group, who will receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Jaider Enrrique

texts.es:
Jaider, un joven de 27 años, vive en el municipio de Montelibano, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de café internet en el parque principal del municipio, tiene alquilado un pequeño local donde montara su empresa.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Jaider podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de equipos de cómputo para su negocio.

En futuro sueña con tener un negocio sostenible, con buen movimiento de clientes y generar empleo.

Colabora a un joven emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Jaider, 27, lives in the town of Montelíbano, a small city where opportunities for getting ahead are difficult and commercial competition is very tough.  This young man with an enterprising mind and a great desire to get ahead plans to start an Internet cafe business in the main park in town.  He has rented a small retail space to set up his business.

With the help of a loan, Jaider will be able to realize his dream of being independent and being able to earn his own income to pay for his education and help cover the household expenses.  He'll invest the money in two computers for his business.

He dreams of having a sustainable business in the future with a good flow of customers, and of generating work.  Help a young entrepreneur with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy two computers for his business

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Veronica is representing her group of seven farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Veronica has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Veronica is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Veronica's Group, and between them they will receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un hombre de 48 años de edad, que desde hace 8 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y a sus 5 hijas no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Rogelio, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 48 years old and he's been working in different activities for the last eight years. He currently has a grocery store that a family member handed over to him so he could work it and generate sufficient income to cover household expenses.

He works every day from 7am to 8pm, and he has obtained good results in spite of the competition existing in the area. He has generated sufficient income so that his wife and five daughters don't lack for anything.

The loan he is requesting from Interactuar is a support to buy a variety of stock at wholesale, such as pastries, dairy products, cookies and grains, among other items. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products and meet the immediate needs of his customers, thus increasing his sales and income.

Rogelio, with his drive to succeed and desire to thrive with his family, is inspired to keep on striving and moving forward to reach his dream of buying his own home, where he can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his family, and provide a good education to his daughters.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale, such as pastries, dairy products, cookies, and grains.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 46 years old and a married mother of five children. She is often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Esther has been a farmer for 10 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Even though she is new to the program, Esther wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Esther hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 32, lives in her own house with her family. For several years, she's dedicated herself to her business, which she has located in her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of corn in bulk and lime to continue with her work and to therefore have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Carlos  Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos (planchas, licuadoras, maquinas de coser, etc.) en mal estado que se usan como chatarra, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos, 54, lives in his own house with his family. He works buying and selling household appliances (irons, blenders, sewing machines, etc). in bad condition that are used as scrap. With what he earns from his work he achieves covering some expenses of his home. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of more merchandise and to therefore have better income.

loans.use: to buy irons, blenders, sewing machines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Our member's face has been obscured in the photo because he lives in a high-risk area of the country.  He's a young man, 23, and has operated a neighborhood bakery for 3 years.  He is well known among local people and has many customers.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy flour, sugar, baking molds and other supplies to carry on his business.  The investment will help him to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
For the last three years, Francis has been running a butchery. It has been very much successful and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Francis is married to Veronica and blessed with two school-going children.

He has applied for his second loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy goats to slaughter to add stock of meat for sale.

Francis will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: to buy goats to slaughter to add to the stock of meat

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard lives with his family in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. It is already five years that he has run his own cabinetmaker’s business.  In a small space of his own he established a workshop where he takes orders for making wooden furniture. He makes soft furniture, kitchen furniture, journal tables, etc. He works quickly in order not to lose any orders.   After they first deal with him, his customers become his loyal customers who like the quality and style of his work. Eduard is married and has two children.  His wife works as a nurse at the dental clinic. 

Eduard asks for a loan of 320,000 Armenian drams in order to buy new special wood cutting equipment, which he greatly needs in his work.

loans.use: to buy new special wood cutting equipment which he greatly needs in his furniture making work

loans.name: Festus's Group

texts.en:
"Festus is 49 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Festus has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as poor, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Festus also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about.

Obtaining this loan means that Festus's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Miriam Yaneth

texts.es:
Miriam de 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija, aún vive con su madre quien la apoya con el cuido de la hija. Miriam trabaja en un despacho jurídico como secretaria con un horario de 7:30 am a 5:00 pm de lunes a viernes y los sábados hasta el mediodía aprovechando los domingos para estar con su hija. Gracias al empleo, Miriam cubre los gastos escolares de su hija y le colabora a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

Miriam necesita el préstamo para remodelar su casa, quiere aprovechar que se terminó la época lluviosa para echar a andar un proyecto en su casa. La aspiración más grande que tiene Miriam es que su hija estudie y se gradúe de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Miriam, 31, is single and has a daughter. She still lives with her mother whom supports her by caring for the daughter. Miriam works in a judicial office as a secretary with a schedule of 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM from Monday to Friday and on Saturdays until noon, taking advantage of Sundays to be with her daughter. Thanks to her work, Miriam covers the school expenses of her daughter and she works with her mother for the expenses of the house.

Miriam needs the loan to remodel her house. She wants to take advantage since the rainy season ended to start out on a project in her house. The largest dream Miriam has is that her daughter studies and graduates with a university degree.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Lisa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Lisa, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 45 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South Distric, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Lisa is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Lisa says that she is happy to have made that decision, because since she first joined in 2014, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Lisa will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 6 solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Florence 's Group

texts.en: Florence, shown in the picture, has been a farmer for 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya for a group loan. She is 43 years old, is married and has 7 children. Florence likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. The loan will be used to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for planting maize. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business. In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de papelería como útiles escolares, elementos para decoración, entre otros. Inicio el negocio hace 2 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como juguetería y cosméticos.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man with all of his batteries charged to confront the world and have a full life thanks to his efforts.

He has a shop where he sells paper products like school supplies, decoration supplies, among others. He started the business 2 years ago and, despite his small time in operation, he's had a good welcome in the sector.

He wishes to increase his product offering and improve his sales, injecting capital into his business. It's for this reason that he's applying for a loan to give himself the opportunity to be more prosperous.

The money will be invested in the purchase of merchandise with which he currently doesn't have like toys and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that he doesn't already have like toys and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jesus Dario

texts.es: Jesus Dario  tiene la edad de 45 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere asistir su cafetal.   Tiene muchos años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Su deseo es aumentar la produccion y que su ingreso cresca. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. NO Ha realizado otros préstamos en una Cooperativa, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en: Jesus Dario, 45, is married and has 2 children who are, he says, his top priority.  He is applying for a loan to buy supplies for his next coffee crop.  He has operated a coffee planting business for many years and wants to expand the business.  Increasing production, he says, will increase the income he can earn to support his family.  This will be his second FUDECOSUR loan.  He's never borrowed from any other community bank but he likes FUDECOSUR because it offers low interest rates and a straight-forward application process.  Jesus Dario adds that he wants to ensure that his children get a good education so that they have a chance to do whatever they want to do in future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for coffee planting business.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from Ijevan town where she lives with her two children, as her husband is a migrant laborer in Russia. Her eldest son is a student at university and her younger daughter attends school. To sustain her children’s' living and to support her husband financially, Meri has been involved in bakery service for four years. She receives orders from locals in the town, and makes different cakes, cookies and sweeties in her small kitchen. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic Armenian woman, so she works day and night to manage her baking business and take care of the household. 

Meri needs this loan to be able to purchase an oven, a microwave and cake ingredients (butter, cream, etc.). This will be very helpful for her, because the oven that she currently uses is damaged and creates many difficulties during her work. Meri's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for an oven, a microwave and cake ingredients (butter, cream, etc.).

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
MODEKAI, who is in his early 30's, is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are still in school. He has been running several projects, selling second hand clothes, Masai type of sundals and a small amount of genge.  He has been in his business since 2012.  He works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be MODEKAI's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start selling sandals, started a genge business, sold traditional chicken and increased the second-hand clothes stock. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to save in his bank account and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy second hand clothes to resell, to buy Masai type of sandals and to buy the out-of-stock items in his genge.   He dreams of improving his business and building his own house.

MODEKAI will share this loan with his loan group "Jitahidi Msakuzi" which consist of four members who will hold each  other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to resell, to buy Masai type of sandals and to buy the out-of-stock items in his genge music.

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en: Sreynak is a 27-year-old student who lives in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is taking a midwifery major. Because she is short of finances to pay her tuition fees, she would like to request a loan. This loan will provide her with a skill to build her future. After graduation, she wants to work in a health center or clinic so she will be able to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Luzelyn

texts.en:
Luzelyn, 40 years old, is married and has a child. She has just started her cosmetic retail business to make more income for a living. Before, she often helped to take care the household chores while her husband was working. 

She has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more cosmetic products to sell and to maintain the motor bike used for the business.  She is hoping to expand her business and build a shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell and to pay for maintenance of the motor bike used for the business

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Violet will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. Violet plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Violet’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
"Eunice is 36 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Eunice is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Eunice's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Eunice and her group will receive a total of four solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
"Florence, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 43 years old, is married and has seven children.

Florence likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. Florence plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Florence’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate five acres of land."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Mujeres De Acciones1 Group

texts.es: Daisy, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Yoro. Daisy lleva 14 años de tener su propio negocio para ayudar al hogar, vende maíz, frijoles y también mercadería como ser pantalones y camisas. Estos productos los tiene en su casa y los vende con sus vecinos. Daisy solicita un segundo préstamo a la institución y es en forma grupal, el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar maíz, frijoles, y ropa como pantalones y camisas para vender. Su objetivo es invertir para obtener mayor venta y ganancias y poder superarse con su familia. El grupo se llama Mujeres en Acciones1, integrado por cinco personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio. El préstamo grupal es por 61,000 Lempiras para la compra de granos básicos, mercadería y abarrotería. En la foto están Dunia a la izquierda, María Avenicia, Daisy, Erlinda y María Isabel a la derecha.
texts.en:
Daisy is 42 years old, is married, has two children, and lives in the Yoro municipality. For 14 years, Daisy has had her own business in order to help out at home. She sells corn, beans, and also merchandise such as pants and shirts. She has those products at home and sells them to her neighbors.

Daisy is applying to the institution for a second loan, and it is a group loan. It is for 15,000 Lempiras to buy corn, beans, and clothes such as pants and shirts to sell. Her goal is to invest in order to achieve greater sales and earnings and to be able to get ahead with her family.

The group is called Mujeres en Acciones1 [Women in Action1] and is made up of five people who live in the same community and who make their living in commerce. The group loan is for 61,000 Lempiras for the purchase of basic staple foods, merchandise, and groceries.

In the photo are Dunia at the left, María Avenicia, Daisy, Erlinda, and María Isabel to the right.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pants and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Titukulane Group

texts.en: Suwema is a 42-year-old woman with 12 dependents: 7 of her own children and 5 orphans. She sustains her family by selling chickens. She started this business to have an additional source of income to reduce her poverty. She will use the loan to buy more chickens to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main goal is to raise more chickens and sell them to institutions like boarding schools and restaurants. She dreams of building a good house and sending her children to private school. The loans help her support her family without relying on her husband.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising and resale.

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is a 37 year old widow and  has three children. She is a very caring mother.  Hicran is trying to raise her children without feeling the absence of their father too much.  Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working everyday without rest and the main source of income for the family is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens, etc.). This brings her 180ZN monthly but she also gets additional earning working as a tailor in her  free time.

She always tries to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Azn from Aqroinvest CU  to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.. This loan will help her to continue her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and  seeds.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora, 39 years old with three children, owns and operates a farm that grows coconuts, bananas, and other crops. Aurora has been farming for many years with her husband and earns a good income from this business. She also sells banana cue (a snack food) in her village to earn additional income for her family's expenses. Her  farm is  doing well, but she needs financial assistance to improve it. She is taking out a loan to buy organic fertilizer to restore soil nutrients for a more productive farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to restore soil nutrients for a more productive farm.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
"Magret is 54 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Magret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Magret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Magret's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Lumu village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yohanna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mohammed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Okasha, Hayatu and Abdulhakim.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mohammed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mohammed spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Fe Ocaña Group

texts.es: Dúo Santa fe Ocaña El encargado de este grupo es el señor Emilio quien se dedica a la siembra y venta de flores, como gladiolas, claveles, rosas de primera, segunda y algunas hiervas.  Desde hace 15 años inicia su negocio obtenido como herencia de su padre, tiene un hijo y al lado de su esposa quien lo apoya a cada instante lucha por su sueño, la cual  es tener grandes siembras de flores, dando al mismo tiempo muchos empleos a sus vecinos que él ve necesitados de un trabajo motivándolos a una siembra propia.  Actualmente la lluvia ha sido fuerte en su aldea y el techado de su cultivo se ha dañado un poco, por lo cual el necesita cambiar todo el techado de su cultivo para que la lluvia no queme la  plantación, por tal motivo el necesita un préstamo para poder comprar nylon por rollo valorado en Q. 1550.00 cada uno y necesita comprar por lo menos tres rollos y comprar algunas reglas de madera para la misma, el dinero que tiene no le alcanza  y le urge cambiar el techado porque las lluvias aun persisten y no quiere ver dañada la siembra ya que se está esperando el tiempo solo para cosechar.
texts.en:
The person in charge of this group is Emilio, who makes a living growing and selling flowers, such as gladiolas, carnations, roses of the first and second grades, and some herbs. He began in this business 15 years ago, when he inherited it from his father. He has a son and a wife who always supports him in every instance. By her side, he fights for his dream, which is to have large flower fields and to create lots of jobs for his neighbors who he sees need work, motivating them to have their own fields. 

Lately there have been strong rains in his village and the roofing over his crop has been damaged a bit. He needs to replace the whole roof over his crops so that the rain doesn't ruin his plants. For this reason, he needs a loan to be able to buy at least 3 rolls of nylon valued at Q. 1550.00 each and some wood frames. The money he has isn't enough and he is in a hurry to replace the roofing because the rains continue and he doesn't want to see his crop damaged now that he's just waiting for the time to harvest.

loans.use: to buy materials to cover the flowers he has planted which he will sell

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Luz es una bella mujer de 37 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres y desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva en realizando cursos y capacitaciones hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices, también realizará algunas mejoras locativas.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes ya que será determinante porque dejo su hogar para aventurarse en la ciudad buscando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luz is a beautiful 37 year old woman and the mother of a six year old boy. She was raised with good habits and since school developed a big passion for everything related to beauty. 
She began her productive stage taking courses and classes until one day she decided to go for it and went in search of her own clientele by opening a beauty salon business in her home.
She is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of products as she also wants to sell the products to complement her services. Things like hand lotion, gel, hair products, hair dyes and fingernail polish. She also wants to make some improvements to the space. 
The loan will be very important for her because it will finish consolidating her company, making it complete and equipping it with all the necessary materials to operate and offer any service that may be requested. 
Her dream is for her company to progress with the help of Interactuar and to have lots of clients because she risked it all by leaving her home and moving to the city in search of a better future.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of beauty products such as hand lotion, gel, hair products and hair dyes.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 38, 35, 28 y 22 años de edad todos están en el extranjero. No estudio debido a que sus padres prefirieron enseñarle a trabajar, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella vive con él.

José es comerciante de ganado desde los 15 años, aprendió trabando con su padre que se dedicaba a lo mismo. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un terreno, se lo ofrecen a un precio razonable y no quiere dejar ir esta oportunidad de comprarlo. José espera contar siempre con el apoyo de CrediCampo para cuando se le presenten oportunidades de negocio como esta.
texts.en:
José, 68, is married and has four grown children, 38-, 35-, 28-, and 22-years old, respectively, all working outside the country.  José never went to school because his parents preferred that he learn a skill instead.  He and his wife, a homemaker, live alone.

José has been a cattle trader for 15 years.  His parents had a similar business and he learned cattle trading from them.  He needs a loan to buy land.  The land is being offered at a very good price and he doesn't want to miss the chance to snap it up.  He hopes, he says, that he can always count on support from CrediCampo when business opportunities like this one come along.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Ismael Group

texts.fr:
Mr ISSAKA est responsable du groupe ISMAEL. Marié, il n’a pas d’enfants. 
Mr vend de l’acide depuis 05ans. Il s'approvisionne en ville.
Mr veut s'acheter 10 bidons de 30l d’acide.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Mr ambitionne épargner afin de pouvoir assurer l’avenir de ses enfants si Dieu l’en donne.
texts.en: Mr. Issaka is the leader of the Ismael group. He is married, without children. He has been selling  acidifying soil fertilizers for five years. He stocks up in town. He would like to buy 10 jugs of fertilizer. He would like to use his revenues to improve his loan. His goal is to grow his savings in order to be able to provide for his family should God bless him with children.

loans.use: to buy 10 jugs of fertilizer.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mikaiya, Dabora and Timothy.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Alba, a sus 41 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en su casa y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 7 horas, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita en apoyo con la Corporación Interactuar es para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina recubridora, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 

Alba manifiesta que su mayor desafío es el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Alba, at 41 years of age, is a hardworking and thriving woman, because she always goes in search of alternatives that will allow her to move forward.

For 10 years, she has made her living in the field of tailoring. She taught herself this profession, and little by little, she refined her technique and expanded her skills through practice. This pushed her to start her own tailoring shop, for which she adapted a space in her house, and with some savings, she bought her first sewing machines.

She works alone everyday for 7 hours, but on occasion, she gets help from someone, depending on the quantity of work she has. This is how she has been able to generate enough income to cover household expenses.

The loan she is applying for with the support of Corporación Interactuar is for strengthening her work, because she will use the money to buy a coverstitch sewing machine, which will ease the production process and allow her to get more contracts, making her business more profitable.

Alba says that her greatest challenge is the high cost of inputs for her work. Nevertheless, this continues to motivate her to continue providing better service and striving to make her dream of accrediting her business come true and to allow her to create employment opportunities. She will thus improve her quality of life and that of those who influence her work.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Zakaria's Group

texts.en:
Zakaria is 58 years old and has six children. He is a group leader, and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Zakaria has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Zakaria also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Zakaria's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yotan and Yarosha.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Esther would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Esther  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aggrey's Group

texts.en:
Aggrey is a 46-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Aggrey has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Aggrey described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Aggrey’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Elyn Lisseth

texts.es: Elyn de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana, ella trabaja como empleada de oficios varios en una casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y colocando las puertas, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de laminas, polines, puertas y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su hermana puedan vivir mas cómodas y seguras.
texts.en: Elyn, 28, lives with her sister in a house that they own.  She makes a living doing housework and odd jobs for her employer.  Her earnings cover her everyday expenses.  Elyn wants to replace the roof of her house and hang new doors.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay workers and buy materials--roofing supplies, doors, etc.--for carrying out the work.  The investment will give her and her sister a safer, more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Gwangwamawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sale would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sale can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Sale, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: James

texts.en: A loan of 2,500 SSP helps James to buy different types of goods to sell in his shop, such as soap, sugar, sail, Benny, etc. It also helps him to pay his children's school fees and to take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nehmat

texts.en:
Nehmat is a 37-year-old married mother of three children who has worked in her grocery shop for 16 years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Nehmat is a hard worker, and an ambitious woman who is always trying to provide her family with better living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new requested products which attract new customers and will satisfy her customers' needs.

Nehmat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new requested products

loans.name: Ruth Beatriz

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer de 32 años de edad, viuda, tiene dos hijas mujeres de 10 y 6 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa femenina.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área que reúne a restaurantes de comida tradicional y donde se realiza la ‘Chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima templado durante todo el año.
Ruth es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que es muy hablada en el lugar y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a sus dos hijas que estudian en la escuela y viven en la casa de su abuela que es propia; construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su trabajo es la confección de ropa femenina, como; brasier, pijamas, pantys, Uniformes Femeninos, Vestidos de Novias y otros. Su negocio comenzó porque sus hermanos se dedican a la confección y le enseñaron todo lo que conocían del negocio. Actualmente ella vende por mayor y necesita una máquina overlock que sirve para coser bordes redondeados; “comencé porque mis hermanos me enseñaron el oficio, luego compre una máquina industrial y ahora necesito una over…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina overlock. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser overlock y mejorar sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 32-year-old woman, a widow, who has two daughters aged 10 and 6 years. Her business is tailoring of women's clothing.

She is entrepreneurial, independent, a good mother, steadfast, responsible and hard-working. She works in a place called 'Sacaba', an area with a year-round temperate climate known for its restaurants offering traditional food and where 'chicha' (a fermented corn drink) is made. Ruth is dark-skinned, short-statured and has long black hair. Her native language is Quechua, which is spoken a lot in the region. She also speaks Spanish. She lives with her two daughters who go two school in a house owned by her grandmother. The house is made of bricks and has potable water and electricity. 

Her job is tailoring of women's clothing, such as braziers, pajamas, panties, uniforms, wedding dresses and more. She began her business because her siblings make a living as tailors and they taught her everything they know about the business. Currently, she sells her clothing wholesale and she needs an overlock sewing machine to sew rounded edges.  "I started out because my siblings taught me the trade, later I bought an industrial sewing machine and now I need an over...", she says. 

Ruth's dream is to have her own house. She would like to grow her business by buying an overlock sewing machine. This is her first loan in the 3 years that she has been doing this activity. For these reasons, Ruth is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and improve her tailoring.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and improve her tailoring

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat was born in 1973 year. She is married and has three children who are the center of her life. 

Malohat has a medical education, and she works in a pharmacy. She works successfully and has great experience in this field because she has worked in pharmacy more than 20 years. 

Malohat always wanted to see her children as higher educated people and high specialists. Now her son studies at the university, and she must pay for his tuition. 

Malohat is asking for a loan of 800 USD with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Alh Ummaru

texts.en:
Alh Ummaru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alh Ummaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ummar, Sunusi and Mansir.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh Ummaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh Ummaru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Alh Ummaru  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shoes in bulk in order to meet customer demand which will increase this Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Eucaris

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Maria es una mujer que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, ella siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales. 
Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.

 Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Work in the fields is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort one must make in order to make progress, but Maria is a woman who has never never given up despite the weather or the circumstances that can happen. She is always ready to the get resources for her family. 

She wakes up early in the morning to travel to different farms to fulfill her work obligations. She divides her time between this work with the sale of milk from her own cows. 

Maria wants to increase her working capital to secure support  for her business. This is the reason that brought her to request a loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of a milk cow that will give impetus to her business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow that will give impetus to her business

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: La señora maria es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega cuenta con un comedor desde hace 31 años es madre soltera inicia su labor de las 7 am que comienza a vender desayunos y al medio dia vende almuerzo  de lunes a domingo la señora nos solicita financiamiento cada dos meses para comprar materia prima como arros, aceite, frijoles para la elaboracion de sus comidas a ella le gusta comprar por mayor asi obtiene un descuento y ella tiene mas ganancias.
texts.en: María lives in the city of Chinandega and runs a kitchen, an activity she has pursued for the past 31 years.  She is a single mother and begins her days at 7am when she sells breakfast, then sells lunch at midday, and she works from Monday to Sunday.  She requests a loan every two months in order to purchase raw materials like rice, oil, and beans for making her meals.  She likes to buy in bulk and thus obtain a discount and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like rice, oil, vegetables, and beans for making meals.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Nuhu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sahabi, Zulai, and Idi.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Nuhu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tatiana Rosa

texts.es:
Tatiana es una madre muy responsable de 5 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Tatiana también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a very responsible mother of five children.  She has had to undergo many adversities in her life; nevertheless, she has always found the strength to get ahead and keep progressing with her family.

She started selling eggs some time ago, and she has a number of chickens which allow her to make these sales.   Tatiana dreams of seeing her business grow, and she knows that with the help of the Corporacion Actuar and those who support its purpose she can achieve this.

For this reason she is asking for a loan which will let her buy more chickens to be able to increase her egg production capacity and thus respond to the needs of her customers for eggs.  In this way, her sales will grow by quite a bit; in addition her business will have new growth and be able to get ahead.

Tatiana also wants to have a big business where she can use all the capacity she has to make it improve and thus offer her children a more stable financial future.

loans.use: to buy more hens in order to be able to increase her production capacity

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de tripas de cordero , la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus culatas establecidas, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carme (tripas de cordero).
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank SIEMPRE JUNTOS [Always Together]. She continues to make a living selling lamb tripe. She is very thankful for the previous loan she was granted and she promises to comply with her scheduled payments. She sells to all of the clients that seek her out and she would like to continue to work so that in this way she can keep taking care of her family. 

The member requests a loan to buy meat (lamb tripe).

loans.use: to buy meat (lamb tripe)

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza is 35 years old. She lives with her family in the North Tajikistan. Feruza is married, with four children. She is very hardworking and kind-natured. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.

Feruza has been farming for 10 years, producing vegetables and crops. She has been in this line of work for 10 years, so all of her experience has been dedicated to producing crops. Her products are sold at the local market. 

She is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 3,000 to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel for the new sowing season. 

She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel for the new sowing season

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 7 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de clases y trabaja con 2 empleados todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Natalia manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Natalia is a vigorous, helpful, hard-working woman. At 36 years old, she is married and has 1 son who she has helped get ahead with lots of effort and dedication. 

For the past 7 years, she has worked in the field of sewing, providing her sewing services as both a wholesale supplier and directly to clients. She learned the trade through classes. She works with two employees each day, generating sufficient resources to help her husband with the financial burden at home.

Currently, she is motivated to request a loan to buy wholesale supplies such as fabrics, thread, elastic, and other items. This will allow her to have material available to complete timely delivery of the orders she has pending, which will help her retain her current customers. 

Natalia states that she wants to continue to work hard. She wants to expand her business so that she can generate employment opportunities for others while guaranteeing economic stability and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies like fabrics, thread, elastic and other things

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Диловар смышленый молодой человек в возрасте 22 лет. Он живет в районе Яван с родителями. Диловар учится очно на четвертом курсе Таджикского Национального Университета. Он будущий юрист. 
Родители Диловара работают усердно, чтобы обеспечить детям светлое будущее. Мать Диловара швея. Она каждый день берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. А отец Диловара является трудовым мигрантом. Он вынужден работать вдали от семьи, чтобы зарабатывать хорошо и обеспечивать свою семью.
В данный момент их семья столкнулась с финансовыми трудностями, в связи с чем не могут оплатить за учебу Диловара. Единственный выход из этого положения является получение кредита. Диловар обратился в ХУМО и ему понравились условия кредита на образование, в котором никзие процентные ставки. Он рассчитывает на этот кредит, который позволит ему продложить учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Dilovar is a smart, 22-year-old young man. He lives in the Yavan district with his parents. Dilovar is a fourth-year full-time student of the Tajikistan State University. He is a future legal professional. Dilovar's parents work hard to provide a bright future for their children. Dilovar's mother is a seamstress. She accepts orders daily to sew women's national dresses. And Dilovar's father is a migrant worker. He has to work far away from his family in order to earn well and provide for this family. At the present time, their family is dealing with financial difficulties and, due to this, cannot pay for Dilovar's studies. The only way out of this situation is to obtain a loan. Dilovar came to Humo and liked the terms of education loans that have low interest rates. He relies on this loan, which will allow him to continue his university education.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies

loans.name: Haller Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio Haller pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, él socio sigue dedicándose a su  negocio de compra y venta de celulares y accesorios, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio continua vendiendo carcasas, estuches, laminas protectoras para celulares entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicita el crédito para la compra de estuches entre otros.
texts.en:
Haller belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together). He continues to run his business buying and selling cell phones and accessories. He is very grateful for the loan and promises to pay his installments on time. 
Haller continues to sell phone cases and protective screens among other things. He wishes to continue working and continue supporting his family. He is requesting the loan to purchase phone cases among other things.

loans.use: purchase phone cases among other things

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana de 35 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo tostadas de plátano y yuca, actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este ingreso económico. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindar a su hijo un lugar propio donde vivir. Roxana desea tener más y mejores ingresos que le permitan dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, sandalias, camisas, etc. Para tener así una mejor calidad de vida con una mayor cantidad de ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Roxana, age 35, is an entrepreneurial woman who earns her living selling plantain and yucca chips. She's been doing this for some time now and she's happy to be able to rely on this source of income. She lives in her own home with her husband and their six-year-old son and she's happy to be able to provide her son with a place to live of his own.

Roxana wants to earn a larger and better income so that she can give her family a better quality of life. That's why she is asking FUSAI for this loan which she will invest in purchasing skirts, blouses, sandals, shirts and more. That way she will have a better quality of life with a larger income.

loans.use: purchase clothing to diversify her sources of income

loans.name: Ashiru

texts.en:
Ashiru is a maize farmer from Kankanki village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ashiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ashiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ashiru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland.  He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby reducing  pressure to sell his corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Juli.  They are blessed with one child, who is five years old.

He has operated a retail store for some years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.
	 		
He has applied for his second loan of KES 60,000 from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to add more assorted stocks, such as jugs, shoes, and other items like thermoses for sale.                                                                                           

Joseph will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.
