loans.use: to add more assorted stock, such as jugs, shoes, and thermoses for sale

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara lives with her 12-year-old son in Dilijan town. 

She has been involved in retail business for already four years. Gyulnara sells clothing from her home to help support her family. She acquires new stocks of clothing from Yerevan town and sells clothes to her neighbors in the town. 

She applied for this loan to purchase new stocks of winter clothing for her customers, as well as perfume. 

Gyulnara's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of winter clothing and perfume

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man who has practiced gymnastics since his childhood. He succeeded with his talent to become a gymnastics coach four years ago, and through this job helps cover fees for his vocational studies fees and to meet the needs of his poor family.
Due to the increasing cost of living, Mohammad's salary is not enough anymore. Thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his school tuition fees. He dreams of opening his own gymnastics club in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: Khursheda is hard-working, married mother of three children. Khursheda lives with her family in Tajikistan and has a fruit business there. She has been busy with buying, processing and selling fruit more than 15 years. Khursheda has a store in a local market. Her working day usually begins early in the morning when she goes to the market to buy fruit in bulk from farmers. She has great experience in buying and selling. She has regular customers, thanks to her good service. She is going to use the loan to buy fruit to maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS to buy different kinds of fruit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fruit for her business to maximize profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build the walls to expand her home.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with three children. 

Irene grows and harvests mangoes, work that she has done for over eleven years. Her husband works with her on their farm since this was the only way they had to move their family forward. 

Irene is requesting this loan to be able to purchase organic fertilizer to restore their farm's nutrients and make it more productive. 

In the future, Irene wishes to have a house better than she has now and to be able to provide her children with the education she did not receive.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore her farm's nutrients, making it more productive.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 28-years-old, married, has two children and is living in Kasese Uganda. Joel is a shoe seller, and also does brick laying to increase his income. Joel has a dream of constructing a residential house for his family. However, he is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital. Joel will use the loan to buy bricks and cement to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Euvelyn

texts.en:
Euvelyn is married with four children, and she resides in Oroquieta City with her family.

Euvelyn has been selling her delicious snacks for many years. She was able to sustain their living with her income and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying ingredient. Her children were still in school, and she was able to finance their daily needs and education expenses with her profit. 

She has taken a new loan recently to purchase more ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell.

She is planning to have her store renovated for a expansion of her business. She wants to have a stable and sustainable income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used the previous loan to buy goats for slaughtering to sell. He operates a butcher shop, selling mainly goat meat and milk to supplement his income. He faces challenges from defaulters who fail to pay him on time and the high license fees. However, he has hopes of expanding his business into new areas. Joseph needs a loan to buy a bull for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy a bull for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en: Matta is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matta joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Bilyaminu, Barnabas and Jostina.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Matta would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matta can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Matta wants to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun provides video services for wedding, birthday, and christening parties in Gyumri town. He lives together with his wife and newborn child. 

Harutyun receives a number of orders during the month, and shooting in such ceremonies is the only source of his income. To purchase a new video camera and shooting accessories needed for his work, he has applied for this loan. 

Harutyun's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a video camera and shooting accessories

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en: Rabo is a maize farmer from Gwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabo would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabo can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rabo, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Samaila, Rajjina and Jetron.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, La'azarus spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To reduce pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest, saving him money he can spend on his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Kabiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mubarak, Jibrin and Sdhabi.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Kabiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To reduce pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest, saving money for his children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita has been earning a living from her nipa hut weaving business in her village. She is 59 years old and still working to earn an income. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for buying weaving materials. However, she was also able to start a food vending business. 

Jovita has recently taken a new loan in order to buy more materials for her nipa weaving and additional raw ingredients for the snacks she sells. 

Jovita wishes to renovate their house to make a comfortable living space for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for both her nipa hut weaving and raw ingredients for the snacks she sells.

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is 28 years old and married, the mother of two young children ages 7 and 4. Alena lives with her family in Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Alena earns a living through retail sales of rice to the people in her neighborhood. She is also a dressmaker.

Alena is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell and more sewing materials, like cloth, needles, and thread. With a loan, Alena will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more rice. She can also make dresses to sell.

In the future, Alena hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell and more sewing materials, like cloth, needles, and thread

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 57 years old, married, has three children and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm that earns her good income for the family. She had repaid her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and could support her children's education. She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home for a safe living environment for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm.

loans.name: Farangezi

texts.ru: Фарангези очень активная девушка в возрасте 21. Она является студенткой Государственного Курганского Университета филологического факультета.  Фарангези учится заочно. Она также преподает в школе, которую сама окончила пару лет назад. Фарангези нравиться преподавать в школе, и считает, что она нашла свое призвание. И она успевает заниматься шитьем одежды. В свободное от школы время Фарангези принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. Ее швейная деятельность стала причиной обращение за кредитом. Фарангези хочет купить швейную машинку, потому что без хорошей машинки она не сможет усовершенствовать свои навыки и привлечь клиентов.
texts.en: Farangezi is a very active 21-year-old young woman. She is a philology student at the Qurgan State University. Farangezi studies in the evenings. She also teaches at a school from where she graduated a couple of years ago. Farangezi really likes teaching at the school and thinks that she has found her calling. And she finds time to sew clothing. Farangezi accepts orders to sew women's clothing during her free time. Her sewing business is the reason for requesting this loan. Farangezi wants to purchase a new sewing machine because she cannot perfect her skills and attract customers without a good sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene used the previous loan to buy land. Irene's main sources of income are a video hall and working as a waitress at a Restaurant. She also sells second-hand clothes. She faces challenges of weather and seasons since her clothing business is in the open market. Irene needs a loan to buy cards, flash disks, and video tapes for her business to sell.

loans.use: to buy cards, flash disks, and video tapes for her business to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Jonathan expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idalia Rosibel

texts.es: Idalia de 19 años de edad es una joven trabajadora que se gana la vida en una empresa cercana a su domicilio desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con su trabajo, para salir adelante y mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de su hogar. Ella vive con su compañero de vida desde hace algunos años, y él se gana la vida como jornalero apoyándola con los gastos del hogar. Idalia desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI ya que ha tomado la decisión de cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este es de duralita, la cual se encuentra quebrada, por lo que desea invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y así evitar que la lluvia deteriore sus pocas pertenecías.
texts.en:
Idalia is 19 years of age and she is a young worker who earns a living at a company near her home for the past 2 years.  She feels very happy to be able to count on her work an thus be able to move ahead and gradually improve the living conditions of her home. 

She has lived with her life partner for several years.  He makes a living as a laborer, and thus is able to support her with household expenses.

Idalia would like to obtain a loan with FUSAI since she has decided to change the roof of her home, as this is Duralita [fiber cement roofing material] which is broken.  She wants to invest in galvanized metal sheets, poles and pins to change the roof of her home, and thus prevent rain from deteriorating their few belongings.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized metal sheet, poles and pins to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger stock of cell phones in different styles to give her customers more variety and improve her family’s economic situation.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, with her family. 

She has been operating a tailoring shop sewing curtains and dresses. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying additional textiles and accessories. Her business grows and does well. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase assorted sewing materials and textiles for her business. 

She plans to expand her business in order to offer more services to gain more income for the future needs of her family .

loans.use: to purchase assorted sewing materials and textiles for her tailoring business

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru:
Этого талантливого музыканта зовут Субхон. Ему 33 года. Он родом из района А.Джоми, где живет с женой и детьми. Субхон зарабатывает на жизнь благодаря своим музыкальным способностям. Вот уже 10 лет как он занимается данной творческой деятельностью. Жители его района пользуются его услугами для проведения свадеб и других торжественных мероприятий. Субхон продолжает профессию своего отца, который в свою очередь обладал хорошим голосом и был известным певцом.
Субхон любит свою профессию, благодаря которому не только зарабатывает и обеспечивает свою семью, но и наслаждается самим процессом пения.
В настоящий момент Субхон хочет расширить свою музыкальную деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить звуко-усилительный прибор Dynacord PowerMate. Такой аппарат стоит дорого, однако он полностью оправдывает свою стоимость за счет качества звучания, надежности и универсальности. Поэтому Субхон очень надеется приобрести такую аппаратуру. Он рассчитывает на вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: The name of this talented musician is Subhon. He is 33 years old. He is a native of the A. Jomi district, where he lives with his wife and children. Subhon earns a living with his musical talents. He has been involved in this artistic business for 10 years now. The residents of his district use his services to hold weddings and other celebratory events. Subhon continues his father's occupation, who also had a good voice and was a famous singer. Subhon loves his profession. Thanks to it, he not only earns a living and provides for his family, but also enjoys the process of singing. At the present time, Subhon wants to expand his musical business. He is requesting this loan to purchase a new sound-mixing equipment, called Dynacord PowerMate. This equipment is expensive, but the quality of sound, reliability and universality of this unit fully justifies its cost. This is why Subhon really hopes to purchase this equipment. He is counting on your financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sound-mixing equipment Dynacord PowerMate

loans.name: Santos Hilario

texts.es: Santos de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 18, 15, 9 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza cada día para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de pollo, por lo que se siente satisfecho de poder darle el sustento diario a su familia.  Santos desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que con las constantes lluvias el agua está deteriorando sus pertenencias, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo para cambiar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and his 4 children aged 18, 15, 9 and 6 years old.

He is an entrepreneur who strives every day to bring money home through his chicken selling business.   He feels pleased that he is able to provide the daily livelihood to his family. 

Santos would like to obtain a loan with FUSAI which will allow him to invest in: galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to change the roof of his home, which has deteriorated, and allows the constant rain water to further deteriorate their belongings. As such, he hopes to to be able to rely on this support and be able to change the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: To invest in: galvanized metal sheet, wood and nails to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old Syrian married father of one child.  Eighteen years ago he started manufacturing furniture to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family.
 
Mahmoud is a talented man who is known among his region for his professional skills. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying the necessary tools which will facilitate his work and provide his customers with better products.
 
Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married and has five children.  She manages her own food production business while her husband works as a cook to earn a living. She had repaid successfully her previous loan which was used for buying ingredients for her business. To cater to orders and increase her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC recently to purchase more raw ingredients and materials needed to prepare cassava chips for sale. In the future, Gina wants to expand her business to improve their income for her family’s better future.

loans.use: buy food preparation ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medication to sell and lab reagents for analysis work in his laboratory.

loans.name: Kuni

texts.en:
Kuni is a 36-year-old differently abled woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Angul district of Odisha, India. She is the mother of one daughter and a son. Her children study in a government school near to her village. Her husband is farmer and earns 3,000 India Rupees (INR) per month. 

Kuni has been engaged in a tailoring business for 8 years and she also makes 3,000 INR per month. She had started this business to help her husband financially and to make some money for her childrens' educations.

She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and threads in bulk to run her business smoothly, because her current sewing machine is eight years old and its not working properly these days. She will use her extra income to improve her childrens' education and health.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and threads in bulk to run her business smoothly.

loans.name: Alhassan Alh.

texts.en:
Alhassan Alh. is a maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village, in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Alhassan Alh. would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhassan Alh. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Alhassan Alh., like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is a taxi driver from Gyumri town. He lives there with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 6 years old.

Artyom is a very nice and enthusiastic taxi driver, so locals in the town prefer to use his service a lot.  The car which he owns is damaged and needs to be prepared for the winter season. Artyom asks this loan to be able to maintain his car. More specifically, Artyom asks lenders to support him with purchasing 4 new tires and pay for the renovation of the driving parts. 

Artyom's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up with loans on soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: repair his taxi

loans.name: Alejandro Cruz

texts.es: Alejandro de 44 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, acompañados además por su grupo familia. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza para sostener a su familia apoyado en su trabajo en una empresa cercana, además se siente afortunado ya que cuenta con el apoyo económico de su compañera de vida. Alejandro ha construido su vivienda poco a poco, pero aún falta colocarle piso, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra lo que causa incomodidades a su familia que él desea evitar, Alejandro está solicitando este apoyo sabiendo que gracias a su trabajo podrá pagar las cuotas de este crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 44 years old. He lives with his life partner and their son, as well as their family. He is an enterprising man who strives to support his family through his work at a nearby company. He feels fortunate because he also has his life partner's financial support. 

Alejandro has built his home little by little, but it is still missing the flooring, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel, and pay for labor. He wants to install tile floors in his house because for now it has a dirt floor, which is uncomfortable for his family. Alejandro wants to remedy this, and is asking for help only because he knows that his job will allow him to repay this loan.

loans.use: to invest in tile, cement, gravel, and labor for his floor.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos un varón de 10 años y una niña de 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su hogar, por medio de la pesca, actividad que realiza desde hace 11 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia logra obtener una buena cantidad de pescado el que luego vende. José desea construir divisiones en su vivienda, ya que actualmente es un solo cuarto, lo que provoca hacinamiento y falta de privacidad, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagar mano de obra para construir divisiones en su vivienda, esperando brindar con esto una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 34, lives in his own home with his partner and their two children, a 10-year-old boy and a 6-year-old girl. He works hard every day to provide for his household. He's been a fisherman for 11 years and, thanks to his experience, he is able to catch and sell a good amount of fish.

José wants to build dividing walls in his home since it's currently just one room. It feels crowded and there's no privacy, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will use the money to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron and to pay costs of labor. He hopes to provide his family with greater comfort by building these dividing walls in his home.

loans.use: pay for labor and materials to create rooms in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tile, cement, doors, and balconies, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with three children. She grows and harvests a variety of farm products, work which she has been doing since she was first married. Her husband works in a private company as a carpenter. 

Emma rises early each day to go to the fields where she oversees both her livestock and farm.

Emma is requesting this loan in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm's production.  

In the future, Emma wishes to have a better house and to be able to provide her children with the education she never received.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is married and has four children. She earns a living from selling cosmetic products. Her earnings pay for her children's education costs. She earns a good living from this business and has been able to sustain it. She also has been able to open a grocery store. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase sacks of rice and corn and additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to buy a vehicle to be used for the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and corn and additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories

loans.name: Chrisostom

texts.en:
Chrisostom  is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He sells foodstuffs like maize flour and ground nuts, just to mention but a few. 

He has been running this business for four years, and his main hardship is limited funds and high transportation costs. Besides that, he hopes of working hard to overcome poverty and live a good life. 

He has asked for a loan to add stocks of maize flour, ground nuts, and avocado to sell.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize flour, ground nuts, and avocado to sell.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar constituido por 5 personas, desde hace muchos años, por lo que se siente feliz de tener un lugar donde vivir. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para dar lo mejor de sí en la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas y granos, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años y que le ha permitido salir adelante, por medio de la venta de los productos que cultiva. María desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable, ya que el actual es de fosa y las paredes de este están hechas de adobe, por lo que la humedad está deteriorando las paredes, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, una taza lavable y lámina para construir un servicio sanitario lavable.
texts.en:
María, 57, has lived for many years in her own home with her family, made up of five people.  She's happy to have a place to live.

She's a hardworking woman who makes an effort every day to give her best in growing vegetables and grains.  She has done this work for 20 years, and selling the crops she grows has allowed her to get ahead.

María wants to build a bathroom because what she currently has is a trench with adobe walls, which are deteriorating from the humidity.

She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, rebar, a sink, and metal sheeting to build a bathroom.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, rebar, a sink, and metal sheeting to build a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her water installation fee.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and get a higher capital. After purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC, it helped to increase her sales and she had plans to expand her offerings. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. 

Airen took a new loan recently to purchase rice and corn grits to add to her stocks.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate her house for a safer and more comfortable living with her family.

loans.use: buy rice and corn grits

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married 50-year-old mother of four.  She grows and harvests fish from her fish pond, work that she has done for five years. Her husband works for a private company as caretaker since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. 

Marcisa gets up early and has to go to the fields where she had to oversee her fishpond as well as her other livestock.  Narcisa is requesting this loan to purchase fingerlings and feeds for her fish pond.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to have another pond of fish.

loans.use: buy fish feed & fingerlings

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is a father of two who operates a farm, growing and harvesting corn to earn a living. He had been in this business for over eight years and he earns well for his family. By selling farm products in their villages, he was able to earn more profit than selling it in wholesale. He had repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying farm supplies. He took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer and a new variety of seeds for a more productive farm. He plans to build a warehouse for his farm products in the future.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 50-year-old widow with 3 children. She has a retail business to make income for a living. Before, she often helped her husband working and raising pigs until she was engaged in retailing goods for more income. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more varieties of grocery items and canned goods to sell in her store.  She is hoping to make expansion to her business and build a bigger shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Irine, 27 years of age, who is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer.  She lives in Songihor, a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. 

To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated, so demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable.  She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy poultry. 

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and extend her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Wiclif

texts.en: Wiclif used the previous loan to buy rice and beans to sell. His main business is selling agricultural products, which has helped him in supporting his family. His main challenge is unreliable suppliers, and his dreams are to venture into commercial agriculture and educate his children up to the University. Wiclif is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: buy cassava flour

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 22-year-old, married, Ugandan man. He is blessed with two children, aged 3 and 5, one of whom is in school.

Henry had a previous loan, which he used to buy iron sheets for roofing his house. He is engaged in boda-boda (motorcycle) transport, a popular youth activity in Uganda, from which he earns a living.

He needs a loan to buy land to start a dairy farm. Henry dreams of buying his own personal car, and building a permanent house. His challenge is bad roads, which lead to constant mechanical problems. These mechanical issues are a big expense for him.

loans.use: to buy land a start a dairy farm

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez's great stitching skill and experience of many years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over the time, the demand of her stitching has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her seven children.  She is 45 years of age. 

Kaneez is in her second loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. 

She has now requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR, with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, laces, buttons, zips, frames, and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, laces, buttons, zips, frames, and tracing paper

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in this picture is her son. He is a van driver and provides pick-up and drop-off facilities for many years to meet the family expenses. But now, due to some maintenance problems he cannot provide better services. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son. He will use this loan to repair & maintain his van. This will help him to cater more to customers and ultimately earn more income for his family.

loans.use: repair her son's van

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpets and accessories

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima has successfully established business of sewing clothes. By this time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more sewing materials, such spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials, such as spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and lingerie

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 38-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shabana’s husband, who is a driver and provides transportation service using his rickshaw. He has been driving the rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses. But now, due to some maintenance issues, he is not able to provide services to more customers.

Therefore, Shabana has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR for her husband. He will use this loan amount to replace tires and get some repair for his rickshaw. This will help him to provide better transport service to his passengers and earn more income.

Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace tires and get some repair for the rickshaw.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat was born in 1996. He is a hardworking and industrious man. Shavkat is a student of the first course at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. He studies at the faculty of IT systems.

He is one of the best students. He always helps his classmates. Shavkat has a lot of friends.

He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university. He awaits your support, and in advance, thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, con lo que gana en su trabajo logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas, ventanas y piso, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de piso cerámico, cemento, puertas, balcones, vidrios de ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir seguros y comodos.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He works as an employee for a private company, and what he makes at his job allows him to get ahead. 

He wants to improve his home by installing doors, windows, and flooring, which is why he is requesting this loan to pay for tile, cement, doors, balconies, and window panes, plus the cost of installation, so that he and his family can live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement, doors, balconies and window panes, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith has a retail shop in the town of Tala. She has been running this business for 3 years. Faith is 34 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children. 

Faith will use this loan to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, salt, and cooking oil to sell in her retail shop. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business, and also to service the loan. This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya. She used the previous loan, which she successfully repaid, to buy seedlings and fertilizer to plant on her farm.

In the future Faith hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 60-year-old merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in the buying and selling of plasticwares, like toys for children, household wares, and many other items. She has a stall situated in a market place, in which she displays her stocks. She is married and has three dependents, ages 17, 8, and 6 years old. Her husband is a welder.

Norma has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy additional stocks and to pay for transportation expenses. This will help Norma bring her business back to normal and could possibly help display a wide array of plasticwares and, eventually, could attract more buyers to shop and purchase. In this way, Norma could afford to buy nutritious food and provide better living conditions.

Norma would like to expand her business for the improvement of her livelihood and for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks and to pay for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is from Sardarapat village, where he lives with his wife and two children. His wife works at local kindergarten.

Ara himself is sculptor. He receives different orders from locals and provides gravestone painting works. 

Now Ara needs to purchase some special tools (with stone needles) needed for his sculptural work. That's the reason Ara has applied for this loan. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for special tools (with stone needles) for providing gravestone painting and sculptural works

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is 42 years old and married.  Riaz is the mother of five children, two of them are in school. 

She has been running a business of cattle trade with her husband from many years. They have two buffaloes and three baby cows. She looks after them while her husband sells them at different places. 

They sell their cattle when customers offer them a good price. In this way they obtained good profit. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They do need to earn much more to meet their expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. 

In order to earn more profit, Riaz has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy more cattle for resale purpose. They hope to have increase in their production capacity.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en:
Rubaba is 56 year old and married, with six kids. Her daughters are married and  live separately. 

She's earned her living buying and selling vegetables for the past twenty years. 

When she was young, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. Now her sons are helping her to sell vegetables in central bazaar.

Rubaba’s income from her business is AZN 150. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. 

She needs a AZN 1,500 loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees. Rubaba  hopes to earn more revenue in the coming winter, which will help her to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees

loans.name: Siriam

texts.es:
La socia Siriam continua dedicándose  a realizar impresiones de documentos ,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  tinta entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Siriam, still works printing documents.  She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can help her family.

Siriam's requesting the loan to buy ink and other supplies.

She's grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy ink and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, purlins, cement, gravel, sand, brick, and iron to build a shed.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, who is 38 years old and married, sells livestock hides and skins in Tala town.  

She used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy hides and skins to sell. It was profitable, and with the generated profits she was able to help provide for the basic needs of her family. Her spouse also provides additional income to support their four children.

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she will use it to buy more livestock skins and hides. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya.  She has successfully repaid her previous loans. In future she hopes to start another business.

loans.use: To buy livestock hides and skins for selling.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the agricultural products market. She is the mother of two and has been doing crop farming too, but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. 

The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. Catherine is very excited to start the commercialization of her crops. With your $350 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: expand her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Esther is a mother of two who has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, maize and milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 

Esther, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Esther is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used his previous loan to pay workers who harvested his tea.  He is involved in tea farming and selling tea seedlings, a business he started two years back. He started by growing food crops and raised money to buy a tea plantation. His challenges have been seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation, and his goals are educating his children, buying more land and hiring employees to help expand his business. Wilson intends to use this loan to  buy manure and pay for labour.

loans.use: buy manure and pay for labour

loans.name: Gul  Bahar

texts.en: Gul Bahar is a 44-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business of animals selling with her husband for many years. She takes care of the  animals and her husband sells them in different markets.  Their business provides them enough to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. In order to expand her current business, Gul Bahar requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy baby goats and calves, etc. to earn more income.

loans.use: buy baby goats & calves

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is a 42-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has some buffaloes and goats. She sells the milk in her area. Her business provides her enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children, 2 of them are school-going. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

This is Hafeezan's 3rd year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milk selling. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living standard to her children.

loans.use: buy a buffalo

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 42-year-old married woman running a business of stitching clothes. She decided to support her family through her business as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shagufta is popularly known in her area for her skills. However, due to shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting the regular demand of her customers. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 30,000. 

Shagufta is in her 3rd loan cycle. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and buttons, etc. Shagufta hopes that in near future her stitching business will be very successful and will generate  healthy income for her family.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 58-year-old married woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of cloth selling. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and improve their education. 

Aziz is famous among her neighbors for her collection of cloth and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors and styles. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 31-year-old married woman, with 6 children. For the past 10 years, Kousar, along with her husband, has been running a business buying and selling cattle. She looks after the cattle, and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets. Their business provides them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, health and clothing. In order to increase their earnings, Kousar has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help improve her family’s standard of living, and enable her to provide education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale purposes

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 48-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past 3 years. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed, but he does not earn enough alone to support his family. Kaneez' embroidery patterns are very popular in her area and she has the best earning resource. 

Kaneez is a mother of three school-going children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 30-year-old living in Mundri.  He requested a loan of 2000 SSP from Woyemfi.  This will enable him to expand his business and also pay for the shop rent.

loans.use: buy more goods

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela, age 27, is a married woman with four children. Her husband, also shown in the photo, is a rickshaw driver. The only source of earning for his family is from the rickshaw. He is working day and night to provide for his family. He has gained two years of experience in this field.  Now he needs to get repairing and maintenance work done for his rickshaw, so Nabeela has requested 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation for her husband. It allowed him to purchase new tires for his rickshaw and some auto spare parts and tools.

loans.use: repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Gavharjon

texts.ru:
Гавхарчон молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 38 лет. Она работает в продуктовом магазине своего города Худжанд на протяжении 3 лет. Гавхарчон обращается с клиентами обходительно и доброжелательно. Поэтому у нее всегда достаточно клиентов.
Гавхарчон замужем за мастера автосервиса. У них трое детей школьного возраста. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита Гавхарчон является покупка стиральной машины и кондиционера функции зима-лето для дома. Она хочет улучшить бытовые условия в доме и этот кредит ей очень нужен.
texts.en: Gavharjon is a married 38-year-old young woman. She has been working at a food market in her town of Khujand for 3 years. Gavharjon treats her customers respectfully and kindly. This is why she always has plenty of customers. Gavharjon is married to an auto-shop mechanic. They have three school-age children. The goal of the loan that Gavharjon's is requesting is a purchase of a washing machine and winter-summer air conditioner for home. She wants to improve her living conditions at home and really needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and winter-summer air conditioner for home

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 55-year-old, married woman. She has five children. One of her sons is shown in the photo. He has been a doing business of animal sales and purchases for many years. He earns a good amount of income to bear his family's expenditures. 

For the improvement of her son’s business, Suriya has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000. It helped her son to purchase more baby goats to sell in the market. 

Suriya is hopeful that her son’s business will flourish more in the near future.

loans.use: to help her son purchase more baby goats to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, wire mesh, iron, and labor to build a fence around her property.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 32 years old and has two children. She lives in the village of Thiba in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, where she is a farmer. For the past five years, Salome has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and fuel wood, in addition to household chores, childcare, and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a setback for Salome who has been earning great profits in farming.

Kerugoya is one of the places that has favorable conditions for horticulture farming - good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Salome has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. She requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to start horticulture farming. She joined Juhudi Kilimo because it supports young and enterprising farmers. With the loan, she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Гулчехра. Ей 40 лет. Она мать четверых детей. Муж Гулчехры занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Сама Гулчехра, занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, на арендованной участке земли. Сейчас самая пора посеять зимний урожай. У Гульчехры не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы купить горючей смеси для трактора и услуги трактора. Недостающую сумму денег она надеется собрать за счет кредита. Гулчехра боится, что она может остаться без урожая, поэтому она очень надеется на Вас.
texts.en: The name of the woman on this photograph is Gulchehra. She is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children. Gulchehra's husband is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture. Gulchehra is involved in growing agricultural crops on a leased plot of land. This is currently the time to plant the winter crop. Gulchehra is short a small sum of money to purchase fuel for the tractor and pay for the tractor service. She is planning to obtain the required amount of money through this loan. Gulchehra is worried that she will be left without a harvest, and this is why she really relies on You.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for the tractor and pay for the tractor service in order to plant her winter crop

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is 49 years old, married, and he has four children. He has been working on a water team project for 15 years and has good experience in this area. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Nuraddin knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them, and how to keep them in control. Additionally, he takes part in the building of such channels. Now their team is building a new irrigation canal for all neighbor regions in order to improve living conditions and fruit, vegetable, and crop fields’ productivity.

Nuraddin requested a loan for 1,100 AZN, which he will use to  buy new, quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team. This loan will increase the quality of his team’s work and their income.

loans.use: to purchase new, quality tools and coveralls for his team

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep is the 42-year-old widowed mother of five children.  She lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Among all the children, three of them work as garment factory workers earning $15 per day to cover the whole family’s expenses. 

Because her present house is old, Chrep decided to request a loan to buy bricks and cement to renovate her house. This loan will provide her and her family with a nicer and stronger house for living. 

For her plans, she wants to build a kitchen and also to support other children to take motorcycle-repair courses

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to renovate her old house

loans.name: Sarci

texts.en:
Sarci is a 46-year-old woman who is married to Yohanis, a 56-year-old man and civil servant. They are blessed with 4 children, namely: Nibu, 27, married; Simson, 24, still studying at university; Demris, 20, has just graduated from senior high school; and the last is Marcel, 15, a senior high school student, grade 1st.

Sarci has been running a kiosk business since 2012. Her daily income averages IDR 200,000. Sarci is requesting an individual loan of IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be used to purchase products to be sold in her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase products to be sold in her kiosk

loans.name: Umid

texts.ru: Умиду  30 лет . Образование у него среднее, живет вместе с матерью и женой.  Мать Умида работает  поваром.  Она тоже помогает молодой семье Умида. Детей пока у Умида нет но ближайшем будущем он ожидает пополнения в семействе.   Умид старательный , заботливый сын, и любящий муж.   Для своей молодой семьи и матери он хочет быть надежной опорой и поддержкой.  Умид  оказывает услуги по  косметическому  и текущему ремонту жилья.   Для расширения  своей деятельности он хочет приобрести необходимый инвентарь   такой как дрель, распылитель краски, набор шуруповерт и другое. Расширив свои услуги он  надеется что, оказывая больший спектр услуг по ремонту жилья он улучшит благосостояние своей семьи и создаст условия для роста своей молодой семьи. Умид заранее благодарен Кива  в оказании помощи. И надеется на поддержку и  понимание.
texts.en: Umid is 30 years old. He has a secondary education and lives with his mother and wife. Umid's mother works as a chef. She also helps Umid's young family. Umid does not yet have children, but expecting an addition to the family in the near future. Umid is a diligent and caring son, and a loving husband. He wants to be a reliable provider and supporter for this young family and his mother. Umid provides cosmetic and ongoing housing repairs. He wants to purchase a necessary inventory of tools, such as a drill, paint sprayer, a set of screwdrivers, and the like, in order to expand his business. Once he is able to expand his services, he hopes that he will provide a wider spectrum of housing repair services and improve his family's welfare, and create the right conditions for his young family to grow. Umid is grateful to Kiva in advance for providing the help. And he hopes for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase a necessary inventory of tools, such as a drill, paint sprayer, a set of screwdrivers, etc.

loans.name: Lizah Mae

texts.en:
Lizah Mae wants to find a better job in the future. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a major in Financial Management.

She has two siblings living with her family. She used her previous loan for paying her previous semester's tuition fees. Now she is taking another loan to pay her tuition fees for the second semester.

In the future, Lizah Mae wants to have a stable job, earning well in order to support herself and her family as well.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Medizis

texts.en:
Medizis is a 30-year-old woman and an elementary school teacher. She is not married yet. Her parents are Melki, 59, a farmer, and Katarina, 48, a housewife. Medizis has six brothers and sisters, namely: Jemry, 32, married; Nowensen, 28, married; Alvensis, 26, a university student; Rina, 14, a 2nd grade student at junior high school; and the last is Adrianus, 10, a 3rd grade elementary student.

Medizis feels responsible for helping her brothers and sisters obtain their education. She is requesting an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 8,000,000. The loan will be used to pay the university semester fees of her brother Alvensis and the school fees of Rina and Adrianus.

loans.use: to pay the university semester fees of her brother Alvensis and the school fees of her siblings Rina and Adrianus

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez has successfully built her business of selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 32-year-old married mother of four children who has worked on her cattle farm for ten years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is a hard worker, as she tries desperately to provide her beloved children with better living conditions. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and buy necessary carpets for the winter season.

Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy necessary carpets.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 43-year-old man who is married to Welmince, a 45-year-old woman. From their marriage, they are blessed with 3 children, namely: Uni, 20, a worker; Yohanes, 18, a worker; and the last is Charles, 5, a kindergarten student.

Yahya and his wife own vegetable farms, where they plant vegetables such as chicory. His wife, Welmince, also goes to the market to sell the vegetables every week. The weekly income averages IDR 300,000. Currently, Yahya is requesting an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, and a hose to flush vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, and a hose to flush vegetables

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Nitanel, a 60-year-old man and civil service pensioner. From their marriage, they are blessed with 3 children, namely: Sarlince, 26, who is still looking for a job; Ferdi, 23, a worker; and the last is Juniar, a 3rd grade student in junior high school.

Besides taking care of her family, Marta also has a chicken breeding business. Currently, she is requesting for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be used to buy more chickens, chicken feed and vaccines.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, chicken feed and vaccines

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a farmer from Dulag, Leyte. She toils the land and grows corn. She is a 39-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is four. She has been farming for almost 13 years. Her husband's occupation is as a skilled carpenter.

Edna has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. This will help her grow and sell more corn, thus creating higher earnings and providing healthy diets for the whole family.

Edna would like to expand her farming business to be successful and to have a sustainable livelihood for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Avis

texts.en:
Avis is an army officer working in Armavir town. On weekends, Avis, using his own car, drives a taxi.

He lives with his mother and wife and is the main breadwinner of the family.

Avis bought his car in May 2014, and since than has been paying for it monthly. To be able to repay the amount left for the car, Avis has applied for this loan.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay the amount left in car payments.

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en:
Tahire is 55 years old. She is married with two kids. Tahire and her husband are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business. 

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. She also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to her neighbors. Her monthly income is about 144 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). This business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Tahire would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. She will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be her first loan with AqroInvest. Please support Tahire.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Irene, a 36-year-old mother who is so humble, honest, and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Irene is a mother of two lovely children that she really adores so much, and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.
 
Irene hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Irene never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Irene started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. 

Irene practices mixed farming on her farm, and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. 

Irene is a woman who is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Irene wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Irene make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Irene hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. 

Irene's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. 

Irene is not a selfish woman, and will also want to impact positively on society; that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Ngumbi

texts.en:
Ngumbi is 76 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 10 children. He has been a farmer in Machakos town for the past nine years, and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy cows and goats. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his grandchildren. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to expand his farming business by buying more goats.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats.

loans.name: Jeremia

texts.en:
Jeremia is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Yansensius, a 42-year-old man and civil servant. They are blessed with 4 children, namely: Kornelis, 15, a 2nd grade senior high school student; Emilianus, 13, a 2nd grade junior high school student; Stefanus, 7, a 1st grade student in elementary school; and the last is Marcela, 5, a kindergarten student.

Jeremia has been running a kiosk business since 1999 with her own capital. Her daily income can reach IDR 600,000. She also has another business that is a bemo (minibus) and truck business. Currently, she is requesting an individual loan of IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be used to purchase products to be sold in her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase products to be sold in her kiosk

loans.name: Sartji

texts.en:
Sartji is a 61-year-old woman and a civil service pensioner. From her marriage with her late husband, Anderias, she is blessed with 3 daughters and 3 sons, namely: Epitrida, 37, married; Mizpa, 33, married; Noviance, 31, married; Yohanis, 29, a worker; Franidas, 23, a worker; and Marthen, 21, a third semester university student.

Currently, Sartji is requesting an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be used to pay the education fees of her youngest son, Marthen; that is, to pay his registration fees and other college needs.

loans.use: to pay the education fees of her youngest son

loans.name: Marlene De Jesus

texts.es: Marlene de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marlene is 44 years old and has her own house where she lives with her son. She makes a living by selling snacks made from potatoes, yucca and plantains. Her business is located in a highly trafficked area near her home. She has many customers and she is asking for a loan today so she can purchase supplies like yucca, potato, plantain, oil etc. The supplies will help her to continue making her snacks and earn more money so she can offer her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: purchase yucca, potatoes, plantains etc.

loans.name: Maa Dharani Group

texts.en:
Maa Dharani is a Self-Help Group (SHG) of eleven active and energetic women from Rohenpadar village of Khariar Block of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. All members of this group belong to the Schedule Caste, which is supposed to be the most underdeveloped community in India. The people of this community are socially, educationally, and economically deprived.

Nuapada district is a most backward district with more rural habitation. This group was started in October 2014 with a purpose to raise the income level of their families.

Jajoti is one of the members, and is standing with her hand raised in the photo. She is 26 years old, living with her husband and one son, aged three years. Jajoti is maintaining her family by running a bike-repair garage with the help of her husband at the road point of Khariar town, which is 10 km from her village.

In 2011, her husband started this workshop. She has employed one youth in the garage and is paying him 2,000 INR per month. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 INR from her garage. But, this amount is not at all sufficient to manage the family expenses, garage expenses, and to plan for the future development. Looking into the demand of the customers, she wants to add some extra service facilities in her workshop. So, she has planned to purchase a water service pump for servicing of bikes and vehicles.

She hopes this will definitely fetch her some extra income to materialize her dream to construct a new house and provide better education to her son. To achieve this, she and her husband are working very hard to save money.

Out of the other ten members of the group, four members are doing vegetable cultivation and vending, another four members are doing animal trading, one member is running a general grocery shop, and one member is making and selling sweet and salty items.

loans.use: to purchase a water service pump for servicing of bikes and vehicles.

loans.name: Beniamin

texts.en:
Beniamin is involved in a retail business. Using his own truck, he acquires fruits and vegetables from Bagratashen town and sells them in Armavir region. 

Beniamin lives with his wife and three children and he is the only breadwinner in the family. He has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in bulk. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Комил родился в 1981 году в селе Гулистан Шахристанского района в семье рабочего. Комил женат и отец троих детей. По профессию он тракторист. Он любит ухаживать за скотом. Он обратился с заявкой на получение кредита.  Он хочет приобрести дойную корову, так оно будет  на пользу семьи. Он заранее благодарен МДО Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Komil was born in 1981 into a working-class family in the Gulistan village of the Shahriston district. Komil is married and a father of three children. His profession is a tractor driver. He loves to take care of livestock. He is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow in order to benefit the family. He is grateful to MDO Arvand for the financial support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to benefit his family

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador que habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre muy  responsable que se gana la vida pescando y reparando trasmallos, actividades que realiza desde hace más de 20 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz ya que gracias a su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Juan desea darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, y por ello ha tomado la decision de instalar ladrillo de piso y construir un baño con pila en su vivienda, y para ello solicita unc redito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso, bloques de cemento, hierro y mano de obra para construir un baño con pila e instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan is a hard-working man who lives with his partner and their five-year-old son in their own home. He's a responsible man who makes his living by fishing and repairing fishing nets, work which he has more than twenty years of experience in. He enjoys his work because it means he's able to get his family ahead.  Juan wants to give his family the best living conditions, so he's decided to install brick flooring and add a bathroom with a sink to his home. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, flooring stones, cement blocks, iron, and to pay for manual labor for these jobs.

loans.use: pay for materials and labor to improve the floor of his home and add a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
