loans.use: to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel and to pay for the labor to lay down tile in a room of her house.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, now 52 years old of age, used her previous loan to buy more poultry. She raised them and she was able to sell them and make more profits. 

She has requested another loan from VisionFund Kenya and she will be using it to buy more stock of chicken to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy basic needs, such as food and clothes for her family. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru:
Мехри  честная и трудолюбивая женщина 54 лет.  Она замужем. Ее дети уже взрослые и живут отдельно со своими семьями. Мехри не имеет высшего образования. Ее муж тоже не имеет высшего образования. Они живут в городе.
Мехри хочет провести ремонт у себя дома. Мехри для этого обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Чтобы приобрести все необходимое для капитального ремонта. Мехри  надеется на положительный результат своей просьбы и благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mehri is an honest and hardworking 54-year-old woman. She is married. Her children are already grown and live separately with their families. Mehri does not have a higher education and neither does her husband. They live in a city. Mehri wants to make repairs at home and requested a loan from MDO Arvand to buy everything necessary for a major repair. Mehri hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther, a farmer who practices agriculture with a difference, combining youthful energy and enthusiasm with knowledge attained through agricultural training and business studies to develop her agriculture business.

Esther has been practicing farming for the last five years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. She enjoys farming so much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Having the traits of a go-getter, Esther has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start a cereal-selling shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Esther will be able to improve her income levels and be able to comfortably take care of her family.

Esther’s projections are that by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and family.

loans.use: to buy cereals and start a cereal-selling shop

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store (variety store). She has managed to keep enough inventory on hand and invests her profits in the business. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in a small village of Tkibuli district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have four beehives with bee colonies and produce honey to sell. 

Nestan needs to expand her business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 2,000. 

With the received credit she will purchase four additional beehives with bee colonies and will be able to produce more honey. In addition, she will start trading vegetables.

Nestan is a very hardworking woman.  She thinks that by helping her husband, they will do their best to increase family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional beehives with bee colonies and also to begin to trade vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: floor tiles, cement and sand to install floor tiles in his home.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 40 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Elena is 40 years old and makes a living selling men's and women's clothing. Her business is located in her home and with the sales she makes, she wants to continue growing. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise so she can continue working and to have higher earnings.

loans.use: purchase men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad es una mujer casada que habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con un lugar seguro donde vivir. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se recorre las calles de su cantón y los alrededores vendiendo productos como: pan dulce, plátanos, queso fresco y duro blandito, crema, requesón, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 23 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia ha logrado sostener a su familia, demostrando ser una mujer con tenacidad y compromiso. Ana sabe que en su vivienda son muchas las necesidades pero sobre todo desea reparar la pila y el piso de su vivienda, y construir un cuarto en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para reparar la pila y el piso y construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is 47 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her husband and 17 year old son. She is very happy to be able to say she has a safe place to live. She is an enterprising woman who walks the streets of her district and the neighboring ones as well, selling products such as sweet bread, plantains, queso fresco, cream, cottage cheese etc. She has been earning a living this way for 23 years and it is thanks to her work that she is able to support her family. This proves she is a tenacious and hard working woman. There are many things that Ana needs, but she has put priority on making repairs to her home like repairing pillars and the floor and adding a bedroom to the house. And so, she is asking for  a loan with FUSAI so she can purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and irons to make the necessary repairs and expansion.

loans.use: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta, a farmer in Tala-Kangundo, used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy vegetable seedlings to plant in her farm. It was very profitable, and from the generated income, she was able to provide for the needs of her family as well as pay school fees for her children. Her spouse also provides income to support the family, and they have been blessed with 3 children. She also supports 4 people in her family.

She has requested another loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she successfully paid back her previous loans. Her future hopes are to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Myriad

texts.en:
Myriad is a 45-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She raises and sells hogs. Aside from hog raising, she engages in buying and selling of canned goods. She has been engaged in this kind of business for seven years. She has four children. The oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 10.

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy an additional pig and materials to restore the pig pen, thus creating a comfortable atmosphere for the pigs to live. Thus, she will be helping her family by raising and selling healthy pigs in the coming months. 

Myriad would like to expand both of her businesses to be productive and to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig and materials to restore her pig pen

loans.name: Abanyamuhate Group

texts.en:
Anastasie is a group leader, aged 29 years old. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 7 years, both in school. 

Her group is called Abanyamuhate, which means “who works hard” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their business for making their better future.  

She has a restaurant and has been working in her business for three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and rice for making more food for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for her family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and rice for making more food for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old and a single mother of two children. She has a grocery business and a farming business. She will be using this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, and potatoes to sell in her grocery shop. She will also buy seedlings for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell, and seedlings to plant in her farm.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Damaris. Damaris is a hard-working small-holder farmer in Nyamira, which is a small rural town in the banana-growing region of Kenya. 

For the last 15 years of her life, Damaris has been doing mixed farming. This has worked out well for her since she has been able to provide a decent living for her four children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

Damaris is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal, named Maritati. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. 

Your loan will help Damaris construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare food rations and feed the cow. The shed will also ensure that the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment. Your loan will bring untold benefits to Damaris. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. 

The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life, with fulfilled, basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Erjanik

texts.en:
Erjanik provides vehicle repair services in Ejmiatsin. He lives with his parents and together with his father runs a vehicle repair garage. Erjanik is very hardworking young man who works hard to organize the work effectively. 

Erjanik requested a loan from SEF International, which he will use to purchase oils to provide vehicle repair services. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase oil to provide vehicle repair services

loans.name: Martunik

texts.en:
Martunik is a taxi driver, from Goris town. Using his own car, he drives a taxi around Goris, and to nearby villages. He is a very professional and experienced driver, so people prefer to use his service a lot.

Martunik needs to improve his car and prepare it for the winter season. He has applied for this loan to purchase new winter tires and pay for the renovation of the driving parts. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new winter tires and renovation of the driving parts of his taxi

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 25 years old, and a single mother of one child. She has a boutique shop in Oloitoktok town. She has been running her business for one year, and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes, shoes, handbags, belts, and pairs of socks to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her business, be successful, and be self-sustainable.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Vergush

texts.en:
Vergush started her clothing business as an individual vendor a year ago.  Vergush's son serves in the army, so she lives alone. 

She rents a small shop in Goris town, where she trades clothing and home products.  Her clothing sales business is very important for Vergush, so she wants to develop it further. 

She has applied for this loan to purchase winter clothing and home products (towels, pillows) for her store. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for winter clothing and home products (towels, pillows) for her store

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
Romik is from Gyumri town. Using his own car, Romik drives a taxi. He lives with his parents and brother. 

To be able to prepare the car for winter season and keep it in working condition, Romik applied for this loan. He needs this loan to be able to purchase winter tires and spare parts. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for winter tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 43 years old. She lives with her husband in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Nestan trades fruits and vegetables, and this is the only source of income for the family, as her husband is unemployed.

Nestan needs some money to purchase fruits and vegetables to replenish her stock and increase her turnover. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 350 USD. Nestan will offer a wide assortment of products to her clients, and this will increase her family income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell and to expand her business

loans.name: Bagchagul

texts.en:
Bagchagul is a widow and lives with a child in the Absheron region. Her husband has died. Her son studies at the fourth course of college.

Bagchagul is a cook. She makes national sweets like “pakhlava,” “shekerbura,” “gogal,” “badambura,” etc and sells the sweets. Now she needs a loan amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new cooker and kneading machine. Therefore, she applied to Komak Credit Union for the loan. 

Bagchagul is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan. In the future, she wants to improve her business and in her personal life, she wants her son to get engaged.

loans.use: to buy a new cooker and kneading machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, who was born with his family, working in their cattle farm and selling fresh milk. Through the years, he was forced to leave school from the secondary level, to help his parents. He helped them in the cattle farm, in order to increase the production of milk and thus improve his family's living conditions.

Ali is a hard worker whose family is his priority. He is ambitious and has a good reputation among his customers, for his honesty and good production. Today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan. He will use it to develop his business, by buying necessary feed and medication to keep his cattle in good health, and thus improve their production.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future. He would like to build a huge farm for his cattle, to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed and medication for his cattle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is an entrepreneur operating on a 140-acre piece of land in the Nkubu region of Kenya. She had been married for 30 years when her husband passed on, leaving behind four children for her to look after. 

He also left behind a significant piece of land that Ruth is making use of to practise mixed-farming. She keeps three dairy cows, 20 head of poultry, and over 600 trees. 

At this point of her life, she is forced to work tirelessly to meet the family's growing needs. For example, her highest annual expense on her children's education alone is over USD $3,400 (one in high school and two on campus).  To keep providing adequately for her family, she decided to think outside the box and come up with a good business plan with favorable return on investment. 

She is seeking a loan of KES 300,000 to start an agrovet business. Her vision is for the business to be a leading enterprise in its category in the Nkubu area, offering farm inputs and animal feeds at affordable prices. She is anticipating many customers, as there is little competition in the area.

She has already invested some of her own savings to get the business started. She plans to use your loan investment to purchase more items to stock the agrovet. Through the income she projects from the agrovet, she will be able to pay school fees and meet other needs of his family without much straining. 

Ruth is a great client to Juhudi Kilimo; she has a perfect credit risk score. She has successfully serviced her previous loan (the same amount as she is seeking today). 

A single lending from you to Ruth is a big demonstration of your vote of confidence in the future of a great woman with a strong mental fortitude of putting her family first and overcoming all other obstacles in her way to better life.

loans.use: to start a business selling farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his wife and mother. Karen's father is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, where he works hard to sustain his family's living. Karen rents a small store, where he provides mobile phone repair service. In his store he also trades in different mobile phone accessories (chargers, etc.) and covers.

To be able to sustain his family's living, Karen needs to enlarge his business. He has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials for providing mobile phone repair service.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials that he will use in providing mobile phone repair.

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Baniswef, Egypt. She has two sons who are both construction workers with a very low salary, and her husband is on pension (no insurance). Two years ago, she started a small grocery store project with a 4000 EPG loan from TADE, and she successfully repaid the loan even before the due date. After some research about the customer's needs in her village, Mahasen decided to buy frozen (meat, liver, chicken, etc.) to sell in her store as there are only few stores that sell such products.
Mahasen needs a 7000 EPG loan to buy a deep freezer and some frozen food (meat, liver, and chicken, etc.) so that she would sell more products and increase the family's monthly income and improve their living condition.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and some frozen food (meat, liver, chicken, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 23-year-old single young man from Baniswef,Egypt. He lives with his father and mother and two younger siblings. After high school, he started fattening cattle and using the milk for sale to dairy stores to raise the family income, but he needs to expand his business as he now has only one head of cattle and a calf so he requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy another cow to get more milk to sell to dairy stores, increase his income and get his apartment ready to get married.

loans.use: To buy another cow to produce more milk to sell to dairy stores

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old married man with one son and one daughter in elementary school. He lives in Baniswef, Egypt and can only read and write. He has a grocery store which has been the only source of income to the family for 8 years. But now the family expenses have increased and Ali needs 5000 EPG to develop and improve his project and buy new and varied products such as sugar, rice, tea, sweets, etc. to increase his sales and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, tea and sweets for his store to increase his sales and improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara, who is a 40-year-old married woman, lives in village Likhauri. She has two school-aged children and a husband who works at the hydro electric station. He earns 400 GEL monthly. Lamara is a teacher and also has private pupils, but her income is very low. She is also involved in agribusiness, harvesting nuts and maize to sell locally. 
 
To make her work more productive and to significantly increase her salary, Lamara decided to open a bakery. She requested a loan from local financial institutions and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start Up program offers "soft" conditions to the country's private businesses. Lamara plans to purchase all the necessary merchandise to open a bakery. She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and is the only business of its kind in the area. After the bakery is open, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Lamara will get an opportunity to lead the business herself and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is involved in a retail business. She rents a store in Kapan town's big market and sells shoes there.

She lives with her eleven-year-old son and works hard to provide appropriate living conditions for him.

Gayane is asking for this loan to purchase a new stock of winter shoes for the store.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of winter shoes for the store.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en: Rabee is a 50-year-old man who lives in Baniswef. He is married to a house wife and has a son and a daughter. Rabee didn't have any education and the only thing he can do is his job (fattening cattle). After his son and his daughter got married and left the house. Rabee had to depend on himself to earn the family's living so he needs to purchase another cattle head in addition to the one he already has. He requested a 4000 EPG loan from TADE. Rabee is a hard-working man who eagerly wants to achieve his goal, expand his business and consequently increase the family's monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a cattle head to expand his business and increase his monthly income.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 24-year-old single hard working young man. He lives in Baniswef,Egypt. His father is on pension and his mother is a housewife. The only source of income for the family is the father's pension income, which is not enough to cover their monthly basic expenses. Mustafa has started a new business to increase the family's monthly income and improve their living conditions. He started a poultry project in his house. Although the project was successful and helped increase their monthly income, it was not enough for him to save any money for his marriage.
Mustafa requested a 5000 EPG from TADE to buy more poultry, such as hens and ducks, to expand his small business to save money for his marriage plan.

loans.use: To buy more poultry such as hens, ducks….etc. to expand his small business to save money for his marriage plan.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is 29-year–old married man who lives in Baniswef,Egypt. Abdullah didn't have any education. At the age of 10 years old, Abdallah started to work for a workshop specialized in car and motorcycle care (repairing tires, changing oil, etc). After getting married, he started an auto repair business of his own specialized in car and motorcycle care (repairing tires, changing oil, etc). This business helped him find a constant income to his family but his customers started demanding spare parts and other car accessories that he didn't have in his store. His customers starting going to other shops that had what they needed. So he needed to buy the extra products to meet his customers' demands. Abdullah can't buy those products on credit so he requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy what his workshop needs to satisfy the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and other car accessories to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 55-year-old widow, from Baniswef, with three sons. Two of her sons are married. The third suffers from a serious physical disability after a tragic accident and is unemployed as a result. Her deceased husband's pension income is very low because he was a part-time carpenter (no insurance). The pension income barely covers their monthly expenses. Regardless of her old age and deteriorated health condition, Zeinab decided to start a small business that is suitable for her abilities and available recourses. She will buy poultry to raise on the roof of her house .She hopes to get the 1000 EPG loan as the principal to her project.

loans.use: To purchase poultry (hens, ducks… etc.) to raise on the roof of her house and increase her family's monthly income.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is 34-year-old married man from Banisuef. He obtained a bachelor's degree in law and now works as a local community employee but his salary is very small and can't cover his family's monthly expenses. He often used to attend the varied trainings TADE held, such as a training on "How to find the right business project", or how to do a market assessment. He asked TADE for project suggestions. After some research about the demands of the local market, TADE decided that raising poultry will be the best project for Abdullah and helped him with the business plan and a 4000 EPG loan.  Abdullah successfully repaid the loan in the due date. Now he needs another loan to expand his business and improve his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more poultry (hens, ducks, etc) to increase his sales and expand his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 53-year-old married man with two daughters. He lives in Baniswef and he didn't have any education. For nine years, Mohammad has been selling fruit, vegetables and grocery products in front of his house. Mohammad wanted to expand his small business by using one of the rooms of his house to be a fruit, vegetable and grocery store. Consequently, he requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy more fruit, vegetables and groceries to add to his new store. If Mohammad didn't get the loan, all the preparations he did to the store, which required all of his savings, would be in vain because he wouldn't be able to buy any fruits, vegetables or groceries to sell in his store anymore.

loans.use: To buy some fruits and vegetables and groceries such as (apples, bananas and some seasonal fruits) and groceries (sugar, oil, pasta etc.).

loans.name: Saaid

texts.en: Saaid 41-year-old man from Baniswef, Egypt. He is married to a housewife. They don't have kids. His basic and only source of income is a clothing project that he has been running in his house for ten years. Said wants to develop his project by increasing the products he sells because he wants his sister to join him in the business. His sister Fayza is a widow with three school children. Fayza's husband died in a tragic accident and she is now totally responsible for her children's needs and expenses with no source of income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale to expand his business and employ his sister

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa lives in Baniswef Egypt. She is married with two kids. Her husband works as a part-time electrician so their monthly income is dependent upon the market's demands. So Safaa wants to help her husband by starting a small beauty salon project. She has some experience because she used to work for a very well-known hairdresser. Her project was successful and she was able to raise the family's monthly income but because of the high prices and because she was having more customers, she wanted to have a 5000 EPG loan so that she could develop her project and buy new tools and supplies (hairdryer, flat iron, salon furniture, etc.) to meet the demands of her new customers, raise the family's monthly income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new tools and supplies for her hair salon

loans.name: Abram

texts.en: Abram is a 24-year–old, hardworking, single young man from Baniswef, Egypt. Five years ago, Abram started a small cattle fattening project to help increase his family's income. He started his project by a 4000 EPG loan from TADE to buy one cow. In very little time, Abram was able to develop his project and had two more head of cattle. Abram requested a loan to purchase a head of cattle to expand his business and increase his monthly income to save money for his marriage apartment and preparations in the next few months.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to expand his business to save money for his marriage

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine provides individual classes of English language from her home. She works at a private company as a secretary. Marine, in one of the small rooms in her house, provides classes for students and prepares them for the exam.

To be able to improve her working conditions, she has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase a computer, printer and scanner and also furniture (table and chairs) for the room where she provides her classes.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer, printer and scanner and also furniture (table and chairs) to provide individual classes from her house.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 44 years old and a married woman, from the village Abedati. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter-in-law. The family generates income from agricultural activity. In particular, Nato and her husband are engaged in cattle, pig, and milk-cow breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivating a plot of family-owned land, where they harvest nuts. Nato realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income.

In order to increase the living condition of her family, Nato has a great desire to get additional sources of income. Therefore, she requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan, for starting or re-starting a business. Nato's application was approved under the framework of this program. She is taking a loan of $4500. She will use it for renovating the rooms of her house, and after that she will rent rooms to tourists, at good prices.

The loan will greatly assist Nato. Using the loan capital, she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. Nato and her family members rely on the good will of lenders, and they will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to renovate the house and begin a new business, renting rooms to tourists.

loans.name: Arine

texts.en:
Arine started a clothing sales business last year. She trades clothing and provides a large variety of clothing supplies to her customers. She organizes sales from her house and her main clientele are her neighbours.

To purchase a new stock of winter clothing for covering customers' orders and ordering a large variety of supplies, Arine has applied for this loan.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Arine hopes that lenders will support her small but sustainable business activity. She is not married and lives with her parents, and the income from her business is very important for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of winter clothing for covering customers' orders.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and four children, in Ninotsminda district. The family is involved in a husbandry business. In particular, they have pigs and cows. They sell piglets seasonally and produce dairy products to sell. In addition, Alla owns a bakery and sells bread.

She needs money to install gas in her bakery, and so she requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3600 US Dollars. With the received credit she will install gas and will decrease the expenses of her business. With increased net income, Alla will provide better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to install gas and thereby decrease the expenses of her bakery.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen, aged 42, is married with six children aged 21, 19, 17, 15, 13 and 9 years old, with three attending school at the moment. She does tea growing and her clients are tea traders. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX (one million shillings only) to buy fertilizer for her tea plantation to increase the yields and sales in return. She started her business in 2004 to earn income. She is a hardworking and honest woman who works six days a week and eight hours a day. Her business is carried out from Kigondo B, Katunga. She is faced with the challenge of poor weather in the dry season but is optimistic she will do well through her hard work. She hopes to be financially stable and educate all her children for a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Philibus Maigemu

texts.en:
Philibus Maigemu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Philibus Maigemu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jamilu, Balkisu and Bitrus.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus Maigemu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus Maigemu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Philibus Maigemu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to reduce pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest, saving money to pay for his children's schooling

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is a Kubo Financiero’s client, and this is her story:

Maria is 19 years old, lives in a common law marriage, and has no children. She describes herself as a person who is really motivated to succeed, and with a lot of goals in mind, she says she could be more precisely described as an entrepreneur.

She has two sources of income to make a living: during the day she helps some houses with cleaning and domestic chores, and during the afternoon and free time, she sells clothes and shoes via the catalog system. 

She asks for this loan in order to stock up her clothes and shoes selling business.  The holiday season is coming up, and sales usually increase during this time.

loans.use: to stock up her clothes and shoe selling business for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar in order to build a room for her kitchen.
